subject: Bump prlimit cpu time for qemu from 2 to 8
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 15:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_images.py', 'nova/virt/images.py'], 'message': "Bump prlimit cpu time for qemu from 2 to 8

We've got user reported bugs that when opperating with slow NFS
backends with large (30+ GB) disk files, the prlimit of cpu_time 2 is
guessed to be the issue at hand because if folks hot patch a qemu-img
that runs before the prlimitted one, the prlimitted one succeeds.

This increases the allowed cpu timeout, as well as tweaking the error
message so that we return something more prescriptive when the
qemu-img command fails with prlimit abort.

The original bug (#1449062) the main mitigation concern here was a
carefully crafted image that gets qemu-img to generate > 1G of json,
and hence could be a node attack vector. cpu_time was never mentioned,
and I think was added originally as a belt and suspenders addition. As
such, bumping it to 8 seconds shouldn't impact our protection in any
real way.

Change-Id: I1f4549b787fd3b458e2c48a90bf80025987f08c4
Closes-Bug: #1646181
"}]
commit_message:
Bump prlimit cpu time for qemu from 2 to 8

We've got user reported bugs that when opperating with slow NFS
backends with large (30+ GB) disk files, the prlimit of cpu_time 2 is
guessed to be the issue at hand because if folks hot patch a qemu-img
that runs before the prlimitted one, the prlimitted one succeeds.

This increases the allowed cpu timeout, as well as tweaking the error
message so that we return something more prescriptive when the
qemu-img command fails with prlimit abort.

The original bug (#1449062) the main mitigation concern here was a
carefully crafted image that gets qemu-img to generate > 1G of json,
and hence could be a node attack vector. cpu_time was never mentioned,
and I think was added originally as a belt and suspenders addition. As
such, bumping it to 8 seconds shouldn't impact our protection in any
real way.

Change-Id: I1f4549b787fd3b458e2c48a90bf80025987f08c4
Closes-Bug: #1646181

commit_message:
os-vif: add vif_name to VIFVHostUser class

When dealing with vhostuser ports, plugins need to know the
name of such ports in order to perform plug/unplug.
The current implementation of vhostuser ovs plug computes
this vif name directly in the plugin while this information
could be directly stored in the object class.

This patch adds this port name (vif_name) to the VIFVHostUser
class to prepare future rework of this vhostuser ovs plug and to
enable different vhostuser plug mechanisms (including fast path)
that needs this vif_name as well.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

Change-Id: I45f73918d51d5fa64a0c0edd557be1fd41db55f7

subject: Process and mount default bind mounts first
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 13:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/os-lxc-container-setup.yml'], 'message': 'Process and mount default bind mounts first

lxc_default_bind_mounts are now mounted before list_of_bind_mounts.
As a consequence, /var/log/ is now mounted before /var/log/log-storage/
in rsyslog containers.
Also, directory creation inside the container is now handled by LXC
(using the create=dir option) just before the directory gets mounted,
so mounting a subdirectory after a directory (such as
/var/log/log-storage/ and /var/log/) will work.

Change-Id: I29be91b4dca5abe1bb8307429a86c06dbd3ef7aa
Closes-Bug: #1648065
'}]
commit_message:
Process and mount default bind mounts first

lxc_default_bind_mounts are now mounted before list_of_bind_mounts.
As a consequence, /var/log/ is now mounted before /var/log/log-storage/
in rsyslog containers.
Also, directory creation inside the container is now handled by LXC
(using the create=dir option) just before the directory gets mounted,
so mounting a subdirectory after a directory (such as
/var/log/log-storage/ and /var/log/) will work.

Change-Id: I29be91b4dca5abe1bb8307429a86c06dbd3ef7aa
Closes-Bug: #1648065

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 14:50:52.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/test_lvm.py', 'manila/share/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': "Explicitly set locales to C in LVM driver

An output of shell commands is processed in some methods
of LVM driver. If the server uses non-standard locales
it's possible that the output contains unexpected characters
and parsing of the output fails.

Setting LANG=C and LC_ALL=C assures that unexpected characters
are not present. Locals are set in LVM driver methods, an
alternative would be setting them in the 'execute'
wrapper method in manila/utils.py but there is a potential
risk of side effects in case some other driver doesn't want them
set.

Closes-Bug: 1589928
Change-Id: If4428eda6342f9f8fb659999e226d837f2fd63a5
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set locales to C in LVM driver

An output of shell commands is processed in some methods
of LVM driver. If the server uses non-standard locales
it's possible that the output contains unexpected characters
and parsing of the output fails.

Setting LANG=C and LC_ALL=C assures that unexpected characters
are not present. Locals are set in LVM driver methods, an
alternative would be setting them in the 'execute'
wrapper method in manila/utils.py but there is a potential
risk of side effects in case some other driver doesn't want them
set.

Closes-Bug: 1589928
Change-Id: If4428eda6342f9f8fb659999e226d837f2fd63a5

commit_message:
[Devstack] Fix DHSS=False setup for Generic driver

Recent change to devstack [1] broke our DHSS=False CI job running
generic driver that was depending on ip route from host to
private network. So, to avoid this error use floating ip address
for connection to service Nova VMs from host machine.
Also, fix generation of second export location that should be dedicated
for service needs such as mounting share doing host-assisted
migration.

[1] If45e3fc15c050cfbac11b57c1eaf137dd7ed816f

Change-Id: Ieea992293ae02898741c939da15f0dbb4609d8b0
Closes-Bug: #1644523
Closes-Bug: #1646097

commit_message:
Allow Monasca driver to process enabled nodes only

Compute nodes might be disabled or set to maintenance mode, so
freezer-dr needs to process only enabled nodes to avoid any
problems.

Change-Id: I7a367516008ff7653126621f0761506356d41f05

subject: Remove RHEL registration envrionment file from list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 18:47:31.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Remove RHEL registration envrionment file from list

The RHEL registration environment file doesn't actually get written to,
so we were passing an environment file with empty values that would
override any values passed on the command line. This removes that file
from the returned list of templates, allowing the passed-in values to
take over.

Change-Id: I0c14e279842d6e9c8ed540cb7605965b39a49eca
Closes-Bug: #1648238
(cherry picked from commit e46cd7d0f3bacc9d2878e0319bf746d3bf182034)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove RHEL registration envrionment file from list

The RHEL registration environment file doesn't actually get written to,
so we were passing an environment file with empty values that would
override any values passed on the command line. This removes that file
from the returned list of templates, allowing the passed-in values to
take over.

Change-Id: I0c14e279842d6e9c8ed540cb7605965b39a49eca
Closes-Bug: #1648238
(cherry picked from commit e46cd7d0f3bacc9d2878e0319bf746d3bf182034)

subject: Fix and cleanup rally non-voting jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-10 20:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/rally.yaml'], 'message': "Fix and cleanup rally non-voting jobs

We have a global regex that made all 'gate-rally-dsvm-rally-.*' jobs
non-voting. This now made the job gate-rally-dsvm-rally-ubuntu-xenial
non-voting as well, something that does not seem to have been the
intention of change I373327609709ad7322e8f0aea9b7f7395e45bd19,
since the job was voting before and in both check and gate queue.

Instead of a non-voting regex, add {suffix} to the
gate-rally-dsvm-rally-{service} jobs and use -nv for them. This has the
side effect of making gate-rally-dsvm-rally-ubuntu-xenial voting again.

Change jobs gate-rally-dsvm-verify in similar way - add suffix and use
-nv as appropriate.

Change-Id: I5b63ae6752231447a9c33c4c822b16c07c525d6e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix and cleanup rally non-voting jobs

We have a global regex that made all 'gate-rally-dsvm-rally-.*' jobs
non-voting. This now made the job gate-rally-dsvm-rally-ubuntu-xenial
non-voting as well, something that does not seem to have been the
intention of change I373327609709ad7322e8f0aea9b7f7395e45bd19,
since the job was voting before and in both check and gate queue.

Instead of a non-voting regex, add {suffix} to the
gate-rally-dsvm-rally-{service} jobs and use -nv for them. This has the
side effect of making gate-rally-dsvm-rally-ubuntu-xenial voting again.

Change jobs gate-rally-dsvm-verify in similar way - add suffix and use
-nv as appropriate.

Change-Id: I5b63ae6752231447a9c33c4c822b16c07c525d6e

Remove unnecessary package installs

Xenial PIP installs do not need all of the extra packages laid
down on the host for SNI support like Trusty did.

commit_message:
devstack: add vnc listen address

Make virtual machine graphical console listen on 0.0.0.0.
This allows to access to VM VNC console from remote ('desktop' PC)
on devstack's HOST_IP.
VNC port may be found by using: virsh vncdisplay {vm_name}

Change-Id: I253899393c98c24d46710aa4ab78f1090bae00f4

subject: Replace local storage of domain UUIDs with leader storage
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-12-09 20:02:22.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_keystone_utils.py', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'hooks/keystone_utils.py', 'hooks/keystone_context.py'], 'message': 'Replace local storage of domain UUIDs with leader storage

Currently the Keystone leader charm creates new domains and stores
the UUIDs locally on disk. This approach predates charm relation-/
leader- storage, is error prone, and causes problems in HA setups.

Move to leader storage and remove old interfaces. There is no need
to migrate the on-disk stored data as it is read from the deployment
and stored as a part of the upgrade process.

Do not set default values for service_tenant_id, admin_domain_id and
default_domain_id. This will cause context to be incomplete on peer
units until the values are actually available.

Change functional tests to run on Keystone cluster to verify contents of
configuration and operation of services in clustered environment.

Closes-Bug: 1637453
Change-Id: Id0eaf7bfceead627cc691e9b52dd889d60c05fa9
'}]
commit_message:
Replace local storage of domain UUIDs with leader storage

Currently the Keystone leader charm creates new domains and stores
the UUIDs locally on disk. This approach predates charm relation-/
leader- storage, is error prone, and causes problems in HA setups.

Move to leader storage and remove old interfaces. There is no need
to migrate the on-disk stored data as it is read from the deployment
and stored as a part of the upgrade process.

Do not set default values for service_tenant_id, admin_domain_id and
default_domain_id. This will cause context to be incomplete on peer
units until the values are actually available.

Change functional tests to run on Keystone cluster to verify contents of
configuration and operation of services in clustered environment.

Closes-Bug: 1637453
Change-Id: Id0eaf7bfceead627cc691e9b52dd889d60c05fa9

commit_message:
Pin docutils version

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build docs
with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version matches
the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

The requirements patch is here: [1]

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409529/

Change-Id: Ie82b943299a89d99aa70f3cc7139ecbb19b4b593

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 07:07:58.000000000', 'files': ['integration/tests/integration/tests/volumes/driver.py'], 'message': "Replace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

1. What is the problem?
Function assertNotEqual(None. ...) is still used in file driver.py.
OpenStack Style Guidelines suggest to use assertIs(Not)None to check for
None Unit test assertions, as assertIs(Not)None tends to give better
messages for more specific assertions. More info, see:

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Rplace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I060639600616322cf0e0698228fa22073a2bf29b
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

1. What is the problem?
Function assertNotEqual(None. ...) is still used in file driver.py.
OpenStack Style Guidelines suggest to use assertIs(Not)None to check for
None Unit test assertions, as assertIs(Not)None tends to give better
messages for more specific assertions. More info, see:

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Rplace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I060639600616322cf0e0698228fa22073a2bf29b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 12:43:17.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/profiles/container/docker.py', 'senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/fakes.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_container_docker.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/policies.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_profiles.py'], 'message': "Fix implementation of docker profile deletion

The profile deletion of docker should override the base class's 'delete'
method to provide additional logic needed for breaking dependency. We
are not supposed to do adhoc specialization in the engine code.

Change-Id: I79c75f4e91b59637995ee338c56a94bea27a28fd
"}]
commit_message:
Fix implementation of docker profile deletion

The profile deletion of docker should override the base class's 'delete'
method to provide additional logic needed for breaking dependency. We
are not supposed to do adhoc specialization in the engine code.

Change-Id: I79c75f4e91b59637995ee338c56a94bea27a28fd

commit_message:
Use constraints for all tox environments

Infra is now ready to use constraints everywhere, adapt
the venv environment to use the default install command instead of a
specific non-constrainted install command.

With this change, now all tox environments use constraints.

Change-Id: Ibb73b4a27b5b0462a9e9f2dd80e437bcc8c7f8f4

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-06 18:29:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Handle ImageNotFound exception during instance backup

If user have already backed up instance to few numbers and then
execute backup api with rotation 1, then nova will delete the
previously created images exceeding rotation limit.
During deleting these images, if user mistakenly deletes one of the
image in advance, then backup instance won't be able to delete all
images exceeding rotation limit causing api failure.

This patch handles ImageNotFound exception during deleting backup
images, logs a warning message and continues deleting all of the
remaining images.

Closes-Bug: #1634773
Change-Id: Ib999138ddbbcd62e0c99a69e5c6d37b4e49f871f
"}]
commit_message:
Handle ImageNotFound exception during instance backup

If user have already backed up instance to few numbers and then
execute backup api with rotation 1, then nova will delete the
previously created images exceeding rotation limit.
During deleting these images, if user mistakenly deletes one of the
image in advance, then backup instance won't be able to delete all
images exceeding rotation limit causing api failure.

This patch handles ImageNotFound exception during deleting backup
images, logs a warning message and continues deleting all of the
remaining images.

Closes-Bug: #1634773
Change-Id: Ib999138ddbbcd62e0c99a69e5c6d37b4e49f871f

The LVM backend expects to write directly to the target disk rather
than to the image cache when initialising an ephemeral disk. This is
confounded by Image.cache(), which doesn't call the given callback
(_create_ephemeral in this case), if the target already exists.

Closes-Bug: #1648109

Change-Id: Ic9178d6c013670611e63d54a7669f35dc9770e91

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix initialising of LVM ephemeral disks

The LVM backend expects to write directly to the target disk rather
than to the image cache when initialising an ephemeral disk. This is
confounded by Image.cache(), which doesn't call the given callback
(_create_ephemeral in this case), if the target already exists.

Closes-Bug: #1648109
Co-authored-by: Feodor Tersin <ftersin@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic9178d6c013670611e63d54a7669f35dc9770e91

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-09 16:18:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn

When we go to spawn a libvirt domain, we catch a few types of exceptions
and perform cleanup before failing the operation. For some reason, we
don't do this universally, which means that we leave things like network
devices laying around (from plug_vifs()). If a delete comes later, it
should clean those things up. However, if a subsequent failure prevents
that, and especially if we do a local delete at the API, we'll leak those
interfaces.

As seen in at least one real-world situation, this can cause us to leak
interfaces until we have tens of thousands of them on the system, which
then causes secondary failures.

Since we run the cleanup() routine for certain failures, it certainly
seems appropriate to run it always and not leave residue until a
successful delete is performed.

Closes-Bug: #1648840
Change-Id: Iab5afdf1b5b8d107ea0e5895c24d50712e7dc7b1
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn

When we go to spawn a libvirt domain, we catch a few types of exceptions
and perform cleanup before failing the operation. For some reason, we
don't do this universally, which means that we leave things like network
devices laying around (from plug_vifs()). If a delete comes later, it
should clean those things up. However, if a subsequent failure prevents
that, and especially if we do a local delete at the API, we'll leak those
interfaces.

As seen in at least one real-world situation, this can cause us to leak
interfaces until we have tens of thousands of them on the system, which
then causes secondary failures.

Since we run the cleanup() routine for certain failures, it certainly
seems appropriate to run it always and not leave residue until a
successful delete is performed.

Closes-Bug: #1648840
Change-Id: Iab5afdf1b5b8d107ea0e5895c24d50712e7dc7b1

When setting ownership of a file or directory, the guestfs driver
looks for the /etc/passwd and/or /etc/group files. In case they
are not found, the current driver lets the auges RuntimeError
through, which does not produce a very helpful error message.
Fixing that by handling the original exception and rasing a
Nova exception with more details in it.

Change-Id: I2d15865c8be13b938e10e67c1b1b160f2a80f0c0
'}]
commit_message:
Guestfs handle no passwd or group in image

When setting ownership of a file or directory, the guestfs driver
looks for the /etc/passwd and/or /etc/group files. In case they
are not found, the current driver lets the auges RuntimeError
through, which does not produce a very helpful error message.
Fixing that by handling the original exception and rasing a
Nova exception with more details in it.

Related-bug: #1646002

Change-Id: I2d15865c8be13b938e10e67c1b1b160f2a80f0c0

commit_message:
Fix command examples in networking docs

All create commands now need to specify a name for the object to be
created, add this to the "subnet create" examples.

Also, the support for setting the external gateway for a router is still
under review [1], revert to using the old version until the new one is
released.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/357973

Change-Id: Ic97733897d4c158bc4432f861e654a47fef6df60
Closes-Bug: 1648764

commit_message:
Use constraints for all tox environments

Infra is ready to use constraints everywhere, adapt
the venv environment to use the default install command instead of a
specific non-constrainted install command.

See also:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

Change-Id: I5b68c9391e80131d7454812280123b72b6ac482a

subject: Workaround is required to prevent deadlock in task serializers.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 17:26:28.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/lcm/transaction_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Workaround is required to prevent deadlock in task serializers.

Due to a bug in core python library [1], if iterator passed
to imap or imap_unordered raises an exception, it hangs in
deadlock forever, the issue is fixed in python 2.7.10, but
upstream repositories have much older version.

[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue23051

Change-Id: I0676de8f74cf4e0d248e0a074b58960bf86b7fbd
(cherry picked from commit 6068002263e9dd3cc730821039b9f315b1a5b150)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround is required to prevent deadlock in task serializers.

Due to a bug in core python library [1], if iterator passed
to imap or imap_unordered raises an exception, it hangs in
deadlock forever, the issue is fixed in python 2.7.10, but
upstream repositories have much older version.

[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue23051

Change-Id: I0676de8f74cf4e0d248e0a074b58960bf86b7fbd
(cherry picked from commit 6068002263e9dd3cc730821039b9f315b1a5b150)

commit_message:
Add Xenial support for MariaDB

Add the elements for building the MariaDB 10.1 guest image on Xenial.

A change was required to the service_candidates to allow for the
selection of the systemd unit file (mariadb.service) instead of the
old upstart script.

Change-Id: Iee0548e109f26c675b1410b6457b9e63ada9c0db

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 17823, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbaldessari'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-09 14:16:04.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/extraconfig/tls/freeipa-enroll.yaml'], 'message': "Add FreeIPA enrollment template

This is based on previous work [1] and it's what I've been using to
test the TLS-everywhere work.

This introduces a template that will run on every node to enroll
them to FreeIPA and acquire a ticket (authenticate) in order to be
able to request certificates.

Enrollment is done via the ipa-client-install command and it does
the following:

* Get FreeIPA's CA certificate and trust it.
* Authenticate to FreeIPA using an OTP and get a kerberos keytab.
* Set up several configurations that are needed for FreeIPA (sssd,
  kerberos, certmonger)

The keytab is then used to authenticate and get an actual TGT
(Ticket-Granting-Ticket) from Kerberos

The previous implementation used a PreConfig hook, however, here it
was modified to use NodeTLSCAData. This has the advantage that it
runs on every node as opposed to the PreConfig hook where we had to
specify the role type so it's a usability improvement. And, on the
other hand, this does set up necessary things for the usage of
FreeIPA as a CA, such as getting the certificate and enrolling to the
CA.

[1] https://github.com/JAORMX/freeipa-tripleo-incubator

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: Iac94b3b047dca1bcabd464ea8eed6f1220c844f1
"}]
commit_message:
Add FreeIPA enrollment template

This is based on previous work [1] and it's what I've been using to
test the TLS-everywhere work.

This introduces a template that will run on every node to enroll
them to FreeIPA and acquire a ticket (authenticate) in order to be
able to request certificates.

Enrollment is done via the ipa-client-install command and it does
the following:

* Get FreeIPA's CA certificate and trust it.
* Authenticate to FreeIPA using an OTP and get a kerberos keytab.
* Set up several configurations that are needed for FreeIPA (sssd,
  kerberos, certmonger)

The keytab is then used to authenticate and get an actual TGT
(Ticket-Granting-Ticket) from Kerberos

The previous implementation used a PreConfig hook, however, here it
was modified to use NodeTLSCAData. This has the advantage that it
runs on every node as opposed to the PreConfig hook where we had to
specify the role type so it's a usability improvement. And, on the
other hand, this does set up necessary things for the usage of
FreeIPA as a CA, such as getting the certificate and enrolling to the
CA.

[1] https://github.com/JAORMX/freeipa-tripleo-incubator

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: Iac94b3b047dca1bcabd464ea8eed6f1220c844f1

subject: exc_filters: fix deadlock detection for percona xtradb cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 15:05:49.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "exc_filters: fix deadlock detection for percona xtradb cluster

percona xtradb cluster server produces an error like:

(1213, u'WSREP detected deadlock/conflict and aborted the transaction.
         Try restarting the transaction')

which is currently not detected properly and, thus, not retried.

Closes-Bug: #1648818

Change-Id: Ic43cb0e0946506a4b7ce9f94ee9eba5e025ed3d5
"}]
commit_message:
exc_filters: fix deadlock detection for percona xtradb cluster

percona xtradb cluster server produces an error like:

(1213, u'WSREP detected deadlock/conflict and aborted the transaction.
         Try restarting the transaction')

which is currently not detected properly and, thus, not retried.

Closes-Bug: #1648818

Change-Id: Ic43cb0e0946506a4b7ce9f94ee9eba5e025ed3d5

Refactoring current upgrade scripts for composable upgrades

This submission splits the different upgrades steps into
the Ansible upgrade tasks.

Note: WIP

The next step will be to move this to use
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403397/
and use the Ansible modules to handle the
pacemaker cluster.

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-25 10:06:07.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/hyperv_neutron_agent.py', 'hyperv/tests/base.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifaa862be3e7b4457bba066405c73a657250a7b7b
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifaa862be3e7b4457bba066405c73a657250a7b7b

Fix mock order

matches the decorators apply order(from the bottom upwards).

[1] http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/mock/patch.html#nesting-patch-decorators

commit_message:
[Devstack] Run tempest update in proper time

Recent devstack change [1] changed order of installing things,
where tempest now is installed later than it was. So, run our
tempest updates later too, when tempest is installed.

Closes-Bug: #1646492

[1] I3d98692e69d94756e0034c83a247e05d85177f02

Change-Id: I85ca94455ad0b7882cde70c6ba0091f9f83f39b8

commit_message:
conf: Remove config option compute_ manager

compute_manager config options were deprecated in
13.0.0, we can remove it now.

subject: change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-09 09:17:29.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/services/triggers.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_cron_trigger.py'], 'message': 'change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC

When a cron-trigger is created, in the output, the created time is
shown in UTC but the next execution time is in localtime. It would
be better if both times are shown in the same timezone. This patch
changes the next execution time to UTC.

Change-Id: Icae26cef37736cb55b9a2460f16e82afdb058165
Closes-Bug: #1592164
'}]
commit_message:
change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC

When a cron-trigger is created, in the output, the created time is
shown in UTC but the next execution time is in localtime. It would
be better if both times are shown in the same timezone. This patch
changes the next execution time to UTC.

Change-Id: Icae26cef37736cb55b9a2460f16e82afdb058165
Closes-Bug: #1592164

commit_message:
Fix stable newton dependencies

Changes in upstream neutron broke the stable version. Hence we
needed to do the following:
1. ensure that the upper constraints are set correctly
2. make sure that stable/newton is pulled for newton

Change-Id: I1319408f1bedcaa166e809eafb2fb00e6a1aa051

commit_message:
Fix docker create class method

This adds an override version of the 'create' class method for docker
container. The purpose is to have the 'create' logic automatically build
a dependency between the profile and the cluster referenced.

commit_message:
Use OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES instead

As we're explicitly enabling services, set
OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES, as setting DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1
enables horizon and hence zaqar plugin expects zaqar-ui project.

Change-Id: Ia666527f807b00233443baa5b314ff30f79a8dc1

subject: Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-12 06:56:28.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/tests/samples.py', 'cloudkitty/tests/transformers/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()

As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems(iter) to
achieve iterators. We can use iter.items() instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well.

Change-Id: I0ab1a012ed744eb0be685e87de0270772c16a9c6

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()

As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems(iter) to
achieve iterators. We can use iter.items() instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I0ab1a012ed744eb0be685e87de0270772c16a9c6

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-07 19:22:38.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add neobunch

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes. Last update was on November 2015.
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/neobunch

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes. The code is python 3 compatible.

Is the library license compatible?
Yes. The license is MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
The older bunch package is available in Ubuntu and Fedora.
Available for ubuntu at:
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=python-bunch
Available for Fedore at:
https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/python-bunch
The neobunch is not available for these distros.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?
Not that I could see.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?
Yes. Required for Cinder and specifically for the following
review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404958/

Change-Id: I3b890f7bf2187f614298fdcd0b14b03be3ee1737
'}]
commit_message:
Add neobunch

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes. Last update was on November 2015.
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/neobunch

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes. The code is python 3 compatible.

Is the library license compatible?
Yes. The license is MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
The older bunch package is available in Ubuntu and Fedora.
Available for ubuntu at:
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=python-bunch
Available for Fedore at:
https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/python-bunch
The neobunch is not available for these distros.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?
Not that I could see.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?
Yes. Required for Cinder and specifically for the following
review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404958/

Change-Id: I3b890f7bf2187f614298fdcd0b14b03be3ee1737

to make monasca compatible with Python 3.x.

New gates will be non-voting so they won't make new/existing
changes blocked but will allow to detect all incompatibilities
between Python 2.x and Python 3.x

"}]
commit_message:
Enable Py35-NV jobs for monasca

Following change is meant to enable running python jobs
for Python3.5. Change was inspired by the recent
changes regarding cross-python compatybility and attempts
to make monasca compatible with Python 3.x.

New gates will be non-voting so they won't make new/existing
changes blocked but will allow to detect all incompatibilities
between Python 2.x and Python 3.x

Additionally, added full set of Python CI for monasca-events-api.
This project development is going to be restarted and by that
reason it should be fully compliant to Python CI.

Change-Id: Ie9d84e3b0ea2f1853a69ba8cd393854fbec37198

subject: Cleanup some neutron -nv job handling
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-10 21:21:00.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Cleanup some neutron -nv job handling

Instead of using "voting: false", we name jobs in general "-nv". Change
some jobs to follow this pattern:

Remove voting: false for
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full, the jobs have already
-nv.

Change gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full-.*,
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-.*,
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-multinode-full-.* jobs to -nv.

Rename gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-ovs-native-ubuntu-trusty and
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-ovs-native-ubuntu-trusty to -nv, and
remove special condition for them, these settings are the default.
This includes taking them out of devstack-jobs and explicitely defining
them.

Use -nv suffix for
gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-midonet-v1-ubuntu-trusty.

Change-Id: I76a7dc5c2868e535fb4481d838f0d0e83066c41d
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup some neutron -nv job handling

Instead of using "voting: false", we name jobs in general "-nv". Change
some jobs to follow this pattern:

Remove voting: false for
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full, the jobs have already
-nv.

Change gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full-.*,
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-.*,
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-multinode-full-.* jobs to -nv.

Rename gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-ovs-native-ubuntu-trusty and
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-ovs-native-ubuntu-trusty to -nv, and
remove special condition for them, these settings are the default.
This includes taking them out of devstack-jobs and explicitely defining
them.

Use -nv suffix for
gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-midonet-v1-ubuntu-trusty.

Change-Id: I76a7dc5c2868e535fb4481d838f0d0e83066c41d

commit_message:
remove cueclient from osc check script

due to the current status of the cue project being independent,
no commits to the client in ~6 months [1], and no release in one
year [2]; i propose we remove the client from the osc checker.

it currently emits a deprecation warning, which was attempted to
be fixed [3] but abandoned since no one reviewed it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-cueclient/commits/master
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-cueclient/releases
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333747/

subject: Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 06:02:10.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/neutron/test_sfc/test_port_chain.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

Change-Id: Id20e7958bc0228577eb73ee390afc80ffcb98d33
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

Change-Id: Id20e7958bc0228577eb73ee390afc80ffcb98d33

subject: Remove invalid tests for config option osapi_compute_workers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-03 10:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_service.py'], 'message': "Remove invalid tests for config option osapi_compute_workers

Config option osapi_compute_workers is integer with min=1, that
means any value < 1 will raise ValueError in runtime. Method
set_override of ConfigOpts will not check value when enforce_type=False,
In the future release of oslo.config, will set parameter enforce_type
with True by default.

This commit fixes warning as follow:
DeprecationWarning: The argument enforce_type is changing its default
value to True and then will be removed completely, please fix the
invalid Integer(min=1) value '0' for option 'osapi_compute_workers'. in
version '4.0'

Related-Bug: 1517839

Change-Id: I7da19419ed13e5d0602bbf5028c3cf7ae30c3c62
"}]
commit_message:
Remove invalid tests for config option osapi_compute_workers

Config option osapi_compute_workers is integer with min=1, that
means any value < 1 will raise ValueError in runtime. Method
set_override of ConfigOpts will not check value when enforce_type=False,
In the future release of oslo.config, will set parameter enforce_type
with True by default.

This commit fixes warning as follow:
DeprecationWarning: The argument enforce_type is changing its default
value to True and then will be removed completely, please fix the
invalid Integer(min=1) value '0' for option 'osapi_compute_workers'. in
version '4.0'

Related-Bug: 1517839

Change-Id: I7da19419ed13e5d0602bbf5028c3cf7ae30c3c62

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 03:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/fixture.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8b1e3dd75c700c3c2d41223309cd6c3af1ebdddc
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8b1e3dd75c700c3c2d41223309cd6c3af1ebdddc

subject: Hyper-V: fix image handling when shared storage is being used
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 18:32:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_imagecache.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/imagecache.py'], 'message': 'Hyper-V: fix image handling when shared storage is being used

The image cache operation uses thread locks, for which reason it is
prone to race conditions when using shared storage. This is avoided
by using file locks, placed on the shared path.

Change-Id: I2b002993b7ab0973960794bfdd81d4fe57bf7399
Closes-Bug: #1565895
(cherry picked from commit 8c40c4268be57ff2f76cf616b53992b0d32e1fd3)
'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: fix image handling when shared storage is being used

The image cache operation uses thread locks, for which reason it is
prone to race conditions when using shared storage. This is avoided
by using file locks, placed on the shared path.

Change-Id: I2b002993b7ab0973960794bfdd81d4fe57bf7399
Closes-Bug: #1565895
(cherry picked from commit 8c40c4268be57ff2f76cf616b53992b0d32e1fd3)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-10 14:16:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Optimize trunk details extension hook

As per findings [1], the hook was found to be a burden. That is
because of the lazy join on every DB lookup required to fetch
the MAC for the subport. Instead of issuing a gazillion JOINs
(one per each subport), this patch modifies the loop and speed
it up at the expenses of some temporary memory cost: it does so
by building a temporary map, looking up ports by IDs (which is
bleeding fast) and reassembling the data from the temp map as
the API expects it to be. Pronto!

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron_Trunk_API_Performance_and_Scaling#surprise_effect_on_filtered_port_listings

Closes-bug: #bug/1648714

Change-Id: I58e39dbf1c83e1204d8d7f436395531ca096b1ab
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize trunk details extension hook

As per findings [1], the hook was found to be a burden. That is
because of the lazy join on every DB lookup required to fetch
the MAC for the subport. Instead of issuing a gazillion JOINs
(one per each subport), this patch modifies the loop and speed
it up at the expenses of some temporary memory cost: it does so
by building a temporary map, looking up ports by IDs (which is
bleeding fast) and reassembling the data from the temp map as
the API expects it to be. Pronto!

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron_Trunk_API_Performance_and_Scaling#surprise_effect_on_filtered_port_listings

Closes-bug: #bug/1648714

Change-Id: I58e39dbf1c83e1204d8d7f436395531ca096b1ab

commit_message:
Fixing sphnix fail issue

Sphnix warning for non local uri (Repository tags) is causing
tox -e docs to fail, I am moving the tags data from the docs to
the readme script. The tags will be added to readme.rst, when the
doc is generated. This fixes the issue.

Tag final liberty releases for Glance

Liberty has reached it's end of life. This tags the final liberty
releases for all three Glance managed projects:

- Glance
- glance-store
- python-glanceclient

subject: Correct  reraising of exception
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 21:51:44.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/factset.py'], 'message': "Correct  reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I59621eef6060928f63ac937527a4421eed266738
"}]
commit_message:
Correct  reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I59621eef6060928f63ac937527a4421eed266738

subject: Skip release 0.13.1 for docutils
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-11 15:56:29.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Skip release 0.13.1 for docutils

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build
docs with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I38580a5f765c7bb586dcf2786e91be15a8eba235
'}]
commit_message:
Skip release 0.13.1 for docutils

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build
docs with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I38580a5f765c7bb586dcf2786e91be15a8eba235

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-01 10:51:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/windows/test_windows.py'], 'message': "test: fix wrong usage of config option in test_window

Developers usually use method CONF.set_override to change
config option's value in tests. By default the parameter
enforce_type=False, it doesn't check any type or value of
override. If set enforce_type=True , will check parameter
verride type and value. In production code, oslo_config
always checks config option's value. In short, we test and
run code in different ways. For more details when we set method
set_override with parameter enforce_type=True, please see:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/523740/

Related-Bug: 1517839
Change-Id: I0e1929f7e6afa9b9d5daa15e04418b7111ab9e2f
"}]
commit_message:
test: fix wrong usage of config option in test_window

Developers usually use method CONF.set_override to change
config option's value in tests. By default the parameter
enforce_type=False, it doesn't check any type or value of
override. If set enforce_type=True , will check parameter
verride type and value. In production code, oslo_config
always checks config option's value. In short, we test and
run code in different ways. For more details when we set method
set_override with parameter enforce_type=True, please see:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/523740/

Related-Bug: 1517839
Change-Id: I0e1929f7e6afa9b9d5daa15e04418b7111ab9e2f

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-01 10:51:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/gpfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_gpfs.py'], 'message': "Fix wrong usage of config option gpfs_images_share_mode

Config option gpfs_images_share_mode with parameter choices=['copy',
'copy_on_write', None], that means any other value will raise
ValueError, the check is done by the configuration parser, so no
invalid value will be accepted and the driver doesn't need to check it
again. For more details when we set method set_override with paramter
enforce_type=True, please see: http://paste.openstack.org/show/523740/

Related-Bug: 1517839

Change-Id: I000ab639e68534e7be111cc3759b6ae1dffd5520
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong usage of config option gpfs_images_share_mode

Config option gpfs_images_share_mode with parameter choices=['copy',
'copy_on_write', None], that means any other value will raise
ValueError, the check is done by the configuration parser, so no
invalid value will be accepted and the driver doesn't need to check it
again. For more details when we set method set_override with paramter
enforce_type=True, please see: http://paste.openstack.org/show/523740/

Related-Bug: 1517839

Change-Id: I000ab639e68534e7be111cc3759b6ae1dffd5520

subject: Add debug envrioment into tox
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-14 12:58:43.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add debug envrioment into tox

Add "import pdb; pdb.set_trace()" into the test case code. Then we
could use "tox -e debug-{py27,py34}" to debug into it. Tox will run
"manage.py test --pdb" which really debug our test cases.

Change-Id: If704f648ad327bc0e66516656ba1169b5b7e539e
Closes-bug: #1534030
Partially-Implements: blueprint enhance-tox
'}]
commit_message:
Add debug envrioment into tox

Add "import pdb; pdb.set_trace()" into the test case code. Then we
could use "tox -e debug-{py27,py34}" to debug into it. Tox will run
"manage.py test --pdb" which really debug our test cases.

Change-Id: If704f648ad327bc0e66516656ba1169b5b7e539e
Closes-bug: #1534030
Partially-Implements: blueprint enhance-tox

commit_message:
Document release artifact signing

Provide some explanatory prose about handling of OpenPGP signatures
for Git tags and similar release artifacts. Also provide a copy of
the corresponding public keys, for improved provenance. New keys
should be added each cycle as they're rotated into use.

Change-Id: I083bc8acf8d95e938afb5446d786eedf4fc43751

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-02 02:22:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent'], 'message': "Fix devstack with linuxbridge without l3 agent

The linuxbridge agent for Neutron expects that the public bridge will
already be created by the time it starts. On devstack, this only occurs
as part of the l3 agent configuration. If a compute node doesn't have an
l3 agent and is using a linuxbridge agent, then br-ex won't be created
and the process will not be able to start (causing stack.sh to fail).

This causes the gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge-multinode-nv gate
to fail. To avoid the issue, skip the bridge mappings setup unless L3 is
configured. This is done in a backward compatible fashion: if localrc
uses the old q-l3 tags, the is_service_enabled neutron-l3 would not be
able to succeed.

Closes-Bug: #1643562

(cherry picked from commit 1c08b191fd04e028a8d908c9ccb4fdc536248c96)
Change-Id: I292ff0dc080fb84b5f879ba2f00f03eff295b55b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack with linuxbridge without l3 agent

The linuxbridge agent for Neutron expects that the public bridge will
already be created by the time it starts. On devstack, this only occurs
as part of the l3 agent configuration. If a compute node doesn't have an
l3 agent and is using a linuxbridge agent, then br-ex won't be created
and the process will not be able to start (causing stack.sh to fail).

This causes the gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge-multinode-nv gate
to fail. To avoid the issue, skip the bridge mappings setup unless L3 is
configured. This is done in a backward compatible fashion: if localrc
uses the old q-l3 tags, the is_service_enabled neutron-l3 would not be
able to succeed.

Closes-Bug: #1643562

(cherry picked from commit 1c08b191fd04e028a8d908c9ccb4fdc536248c96)
Change-Id: I292ff0dc080fb84b5f879ba2f00f03eff295b55b

the python-xml is a subpackage from the standard cpython package that
that contains elementtree and other bits that are needed almost
everywhere in OpenStack but isn't installed on a absolutely minimal
openSUSE Leap installation. This package doesn't exist on pip but

commit_message:
[opensuse] add python-xml to general deps list

the python-xml is a subpackage from the standard cpython package that
that contains elementtree and other bits that are needed almost
everywhere in OpenStack but isn't installed on a absolutely minimal
openSUSE Leap installation. This package doesn't exist on pip but
is a SUSE only invention, so just treat it similar to a bindep.

Change-Id: I82887c2e6895740d1b16d1269574519450ca783e

commit_message:
Handle ConnectFailure from keystone when neutron is down

Keystone raises an exception ConnectFailure with 500 as code
when neutron server is down. As such we convert it to 504
and list the correct error message telling neutron server
connection has failed.

Change-Id: If68abf0f9145352fb6890d71bf418b04150a1a5d
Closes-Bug: #1567655

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-28 18:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': "VMware: Use ESXi host port during image copy

Currently the image copy from the glance to datastore happens through
ESXi host, this is failing when a vCenter is configured to listen on
a non-default port. This is because the URL to copy the image
framed using vCenter port rather than ESXi's host port.

This patch address that issue by retriving host port explicitly to

Change-Id: I412eaa6b66ca876ed24ed0e95b0ba12c2930bdd5
Closes-bug: #1600710
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Use ESXi host port during image copy

Currently the image copy from the glance to datastore happens through
ESXi host, this is failing when a vCenter is configured to listen on
a non-default port. This is because the URL to copy the image
framed using vCenter port rather than ESXi's host port.

This patch address that issue by retriving host port explicitly to
frame the URL.

Change-Id: I412eaa6b66ca876ed24ed0e95b0ba12c2930bdd5
Closes-bug: #1600710

commit_message:
stop adding log handler

A StreamHandler was being setup that dumped logs to the console
regardless of the user's wishes. This removes that StreamHandler
setup so that the user can control the logging themselves.

Change-Id: I02756539a7c094153b9ec29a0ff2fecaabd44f71
Closes-Bug: #1647846

subject: Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-01 12:25:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/pools.py', 'cinderclient/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'cinderclient/auth_plugin.py', 'cinderclient/apiclient/base.py', 'cinderclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()

As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems(iter) to
achieve iterators. We can use iter.items() instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic41abf2ca6ec3ecb651b980091b52d0a185c9089
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()

As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems(iter) to
achieve iterators. We can use iter.items() instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic41abf2ca6ec3ecb651b980091b52d0a185c9089

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-01 18:28:47.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/policy.json'], 'message': 'Admin API policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions, the role must be assigned to a project
that is deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server. This
prevents someone being assigned admin on some random project
from being admin everywhere.

Change-Id: Ic4294cc1746702c345259c64bad1e20675a7d9ab
Closes-Bug: 968696
'}]
commit_message:
Admin API policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions, the role must be assigned to a project
that is deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server. This
prevents someone being assigned admin on some random project
from being admin everywhere.

Change-Id: Ic4294cc1746702c345259c64bad1e20675a7d9ab
Closes-Bug: 968696

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Create a CG from a source CG

Currently, we can only create a consistency group from a
cg snapshot. This updates the api to accommodate creating
a cg from another cg

Change-Id: I6fd01739b62fd399cf9a397431c10a2a7f7ec0f2
Implements: blueprint vmax-clone-cg

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-11 09:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/drivers/haproxy/namespace_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/haproxy/test_namespace_driver.py'], 'message': 'Delete the lbaas namespace when deleting the listener.

The loadbalancer instance will be deleted at the deleting of
listener. Everything is deleted except the namespace. When user
delete the loadbalancer, the undeploy_instance will not be
executed because the loadbalancer instance does not exist. So,
the lbaas namespace will be orphan.

Change-Id: I6a76f47c8cfe18094893bf1b51114a439521fb7b
Closes-Bug: #1495430
'}]
commit_message:
Delete the lbaas namespace when deleting the listener.

The loadbalancer instance will be deleted at the deleting of
listener. Everything is deleted except the namespace. When user
delete the loadbalancer, the undeploy_instance will not be
executed because the loadbalancer instance does not exist. So,
the lbaas namespace will be orphan.

Change-Id: I6a76f47c8cfe18094893bf1b51114a439521fb7b
Closes-Bug: #1495430

which is default.

subject: Skip larger than /64 subnets in DHCP agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-11 00:44:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': "Skip larger than /64 subnets in DHCP agent

Dnsmasq can't handle these in IPv6 so we need to skip them to avoid
a whole bunch of log noise caused by continual retrying of issues.

Closes-Bug: #1645616
Change-Id: I36d167506cc45731e3f500a0c59b70b1bc27590f
(cherry picked from commit 028a349bc531cbcd91fd15f072be4b84952376b8)
"}]
commit_message:
Skip larger than /64 subnets in DHCP agent

Dnsmasq can't handle these in IPv6 so we need to skip them to avoid
a whole bunch of log noise caused by continual retrying of issues.

Closes-Bug: #1645616
Change-Id: I36d167506cc45731e3f500a0c59b70b1bc27590f
(cherry picked from commit 028a349bc531cbcd91fd15f072be4b84952376b8)

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/f907715eb1888bccc70128ba091071cb\n'

Change-Id: I9be2dbbd9de344452fce9aef1c2c066b6aa34f23

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/cf3794cdfc5c5f4173a1136e70add407\n'

This gives us a quick identifier property on SecurityGroup that
will prefer uuid if set, otherwise use the name field.

commit_message:
Modified the VNFD Resource state to OnBoarded.

Currently, in Horizon and CLI, the display for the the VNFD state
is set to "Not Applicable".Modified to display "OnBoarded" once the
VNFD is created..

Change-Id: I1a67638b488895378b16662625cab0f8bca90e53
Closes-Bug: #1623067

common services. This patch set changes the template and modifies

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I79bca67a2d242959e751a64b08dcf865bb870d2d

commit_message:
Change _common_svc.yaml to support differing service names

In some cases, the name of the service and the selector value need
to differ, as was the case in the old templates for kolla-k8s
common services. This patch set changes the template and modifies
existing services leveraging the _common_svc.yaml to use the new
variable.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I79bca67a2d242959e751a64b08dcf865bb870d2d

subject: Try to set initial mysql root password also on Ubuntu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 20:18:07.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql'], 'message': 'Try to set initial mysql root password also on Ubuntu

On Ubuntu nodes, devstack tries to predefine the initial mysql root
password by doing some debconf-set-selections, but these will not take
effect if the corresponding package has been installed earlier. So
just try to set it every time, like we do on other distros.

Change-Id: I2c167051fc5e53dd0ccf82a60ab085cd9cdea28d
'}]
commit_message:
Try to set initial mysql root password also on Ubuntu

On Ubuntu nodes, devstack tries to predefine the initial mysql root
password by doing some debconf-set-selections, but these will not take
effect if the corresponding package has been installed earlier. So
just try to set it every time, like we do on other distros.

Change-Id: I2c167051fc5e53dd0ccf82a60ab085cd9cdea28d

commit_message:
Add .gitattributes file

Make sure all text based files are marked as force lf line endings
instead of the default autocrlf.

This should hopfully prevent crlf from continuing to prolifirate the
code base.

Change-Id: I109bbfcc5fd6ffbaefe1a269ba6aed5e658a2e8e

subject: Kill the green thread immediately if it is sleeping
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-08 07:36:33.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/services/operationengine/engine/triggers/timetrigger/time_trigger.py'], 'message': "Kill the green thread immediately if it is sleeping

It will be failed to kill the green thread, if it is running.
But if it is not, we can kill it immediately. Try to kill green
thread immediately and thus don't need wait it to wake up,
then check the self._running and exit.

Change-Id: Ie7d427e386fb71988ca4276dfb2c41667439e4dd
"}]
commit_message:
Kill the green thread immediately if it is sleeping

It will be failed to kill the green thread, if it is running.
But if it is not, we can kill it immediately. Try to kill green
thread immediately and thus don't need wait it to wake up,
then check the self._running and exit.

Change-Id: Ie7d427e386fb71988ca4276dfb2c41667439e4dd

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-06 22:14:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Handle MarkerNotFound from cell0 database

When listing instances in the cellv2 world we look them up
from three locations:

1. Build requests which exist before the instances are created
   in the cell database (after the scheduler picks a host to
   build the instance). Currently instances and build requests
   are both created before casting to conductor, but that's going
   away in Ocata with the support for multiple cellsv2 cells.
2. The cell0 database for instances which failed to get scheduled
   to a compute host (and therefore a cell).
3. The actual cell database that the instance lives in. Currently
   that's only a single traditional nova database, but could be one
   of multiple cellsv2 cells when we add that support in Ocata.

If a marker is passed in when listing instances, if the instance
lives in an actual cell database, we'll get a MarkerNotFound failure
from cell0 because the instance doesn't exist in cell0, but we check
cell0 before we check the cell database. This makes the instance
listing short-circuit and fail with a 400 from the REST API.

This patch simply handles the MarkerNotFound when listing instances
from the cell0 database and ignores it so we can continue onto the
cell database.

Closes-Bug: #1647464

Change-Id: I977497be262fb7f2333e32fb7313b29624323422
"}]
commit_message:
Handle MarkerNotFound from cell0 database

When listing instances in the cellv2 world we look them up
from three locations:

1. Build requests which exist before the instances are created
   in the cell database (after the scheduler picks a host to
   build the instance). Currently instances and build requests
   are both created before casting to conductor, but that's going
   away in Ocata with the support for multiple cellsv2 cells.
2. The cell0 database for instances which failed to get scheduled
   to a compute host (and therefore a cell).
3. The actual cell database that the instance lives in. Currently
   that's only a single traditional nova database, but could be one
   of multiple cellsv2 cells when we add that support in Ocata.

If a marker is passed in when listing instances, if the instance
lives in an actual cell database, we'll get a MarkerNotFound failure
from cell0 because the instance doesn't exist in cell0, but we check
cell0 before we check the cell database. This makes the instance
listing short-circuit and fail with a 400 from the REST API.

This patch simply handles the MarkerNotFound when listing instances
from the cell0 database and ignores it so we can continue onto the
cell database.

Closes-Bug: #1647464

Change-Id: I977497be262fb7f2333e32fb7313b29624323422

commit_message:
Add support to update members in LBaaS extension

Currently, members are not registered in quotas.
This patch adds support to register members for
quota and thus provide support for quota update.

commit_message:
Use uuidutils instead of uuid.uuid4()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Fixes bug #1082248

Change-Id: I59190fc01cc90e052aef3d5c96eb9f9b606115ac

commit_message:
Ensure X-Designate-Edit-Managed-Records header value is a string

Header values are strings so we should provide a string as
X-Designate-Edit-Managed-Records header value instead of a boolean
(which is transformed into: "<type 'bool'>" by python-requests).

Change-Id: Iaf248a0e817fe65785ddcdca46663e7273a6dad0

commit_message:
Add more log when delete orphan node

we have following log when delete opphan node
INFO nova.compute.manager Deleting orphan compute node xx

we might need to know why those node are removed so
we need additional log info about the removal.
however, it's not complete about why it's removed and
what's removed unless we dig into database layer

Change-Id: Icd8a60aea2fbe01f358bcdb010c97751625b47f6

subject: Fix gate failure
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-11 03:43:54.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/neutron/services/l3_router_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix gate failure

Commit 6948467b770df68cb96877f3e0e710650ad63fd4 adds WorkerSupportServiceMixin
in the inheritance chain, which conflicts with NeutronDbPluginV2 and
CommonDbMixin.
NeutronDbPluginV2 should not be as super class of DFL3RouterPlugin, so this
patch just remove it from super class list.

Change-Id: I4019b2c642daf4ee39527c62d023a6eb8de30cd5
Closes-Bug: #1648930
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate failure

Commit 6948467b770df68cb96877f3e0e710650ad63fd4 adds WorkerSupportServiceMixin
in the inheritance chain, which conflicts with NeutronDbPluginV2 and
CommonDbMixin.
NeutronDbPluginV2 should not be as super class of DFL3RouterPlugin, so this
patch just remove it from super class list.

Change-Id: I4019b2c642daf4ee39527c62d023a6eb8de30cd5
Closes-Bug: #1648930

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-08 17:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_db.py'], 'message': "Get rid of DVR override of add_router_interface

DVR had a complete copy and paste of the l3_db
add_router_interface. This patch gets rid of that
by adding in a some args to existing callbacks. \o/

This also has a variable rename from 'new_port' to
'new_router_intf' to clearly indicate that it's referring
to the creation of a new router interface regardless of
the creation of a core plugin port.

Change-Id: I6192c41419a992be9d0ded338f7a87ebcefda6af
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of DVR override of add_router_interface

DVR had a complete copy and paste of the l3_db
add_router_interface. This patch gets rid of that
by adding in a some args to existing callbacks. \o/

This also has a variable rename from 'new_port' to
'new_router_intf' to clearly indicate that it's referring
to the creation of a new router interface regardless of
the creation of a core plugin port.

Change-Id: I6192c41419a992be9d0ded338f7a87ebcefda6af

subject: Use wait_until in create_test_server to wait for server ACTIVE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 08:50:24.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/floating_ips/test_floating_ips_actions.py', 'tempest/api/compute/security_groups/test_security_groups.py'], 'message': "Use wait_until in create_test_server to wait for server ACTIVE

In some testcases, waiters.wait_for_server_status(..., 'ACTIVE') after
self.create_test_server() can be replaced by self.create_test_server(
wait_until='ACTIVE').

Change-Id: Idb9dbfee830344e4087972c59b444b477d3a0c05
"}]
commit_message:
Use wait_until in create_test_server to wait for server ACTIVE

In some testcases, waiters.wait_for_server_status(..., 'ACTIVE') after
self.create_test_server() can be replaced by self.create_test_server(
wait_until='ACTIVE').

commit_message:
Fix import method to follow community guideline

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as community guideline [1].
[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

Change-Id: I34636afad831522e0781a5e48c5a25e960a04ff5

Maintaining the context is important for keeping the request ID
and subsequently operator/developer sanity while debugging.
The resource_type is also helpful to have since a function could be
subscribed for multiple resources.

This maintains and deprecates the existing 'subscribe' method for
backwards compatibility with callbacks that don't support receiving
the context and resource type. A new 'register' method is added
for callbacks to use that are compatible with receiving the context.

Change-Id: I06c8302951c99039b532acd9f2a68d5b989fdab5
"}]
commit_message:
Pass context and resource_type in RPC callback

Maintaining the context is important for keeping the request ID
and subsequently operator/developer sanity while debugging.
The resource_type is also helpful to have since a function could be
subscribed for multiple resources.

This maintains and deprecates the existing 'subscribe' method for
backwards compatibility with callbacks that don't support receiving
the context and resource type. A new 'register' method is added
for callbacks to use that are compatible with receiving the context.

Change-Id: I06c8302951c99039b532acd9f2a68d5b989fdab5

The previous ps attempted to check for dns issues. We discovered some
more and this fixes the rest. The gate now checks to see if dns both
internally and externally works and blocks until it does. It fixes
external dns on Ubuntu. It also cleans up the gate output to make it
easier to see the last thing that failed.

Change-Id: I52226ff4d8419b717487428fbf0e5c832ceedb27
'}]
commit_message:
More dns gate fixes

The previous ps attempted to check for dns issues. We discovered some
more and this fixes the rest. The gate now checks to see if dns both
internally and externally works and blocks until it does. It fixes
external dns on Ubuntu. It also cleans up the gate output to make it
easier to see the last thing that failed.

Change-Id: I52226ff4d8419b717487428fbf0e5c832ceedb27

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-08 13:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'Extend get_all_by_filters to support resource criteria

Given the scheduler wants to know which RPs can support a set of different
requests, each one having a resource class with an amount, we need to
modify the current ResourceProviderList method for returning a subset.
The proposal for the request parameter is a dictionary of amounts keyed
by the resource class name.

Change-Id: I94e800dabd5cc995728898dd6d8f6d42ba645312
Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-providers-get-by-request
'}]
commit_message:
Extend get_all_by_filters to support resource criteria

Given the scheduler wants to know which RPs can support a set of different
requests, each one having a resource class with an amount, we need to
modify the current ResourceProviderList method for returning a subset.
The proposal for the request parameter is a dictionary of amounts keyed
by the resource class name.

Change-Id: I94e800dabd5cc995728898dd6d8f6d42ba645312
Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-providers-get-by-request

subject: SRIOV: don't block report_state with device count
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 13:19:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_sriov_nic_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/sriov_nic_agent.py'], 'message': "SRIOV: don't block report_state with device count

The device count process can be quite slow on a system with
lots of interfaces. Doing this during report_state can block
it long enough that the agent will be reported as dead and
bindings will fail.

This adjusts the logic to only update the configuration during
the normal device retrieval for the scan loop. This will leave
the report_state loop unblocked by the operation so the agent
doesn't get reported as dead (which blocks port binding).

Closes-Bug: #1648206
Change-Id: Iff45fb6617974b1eceeed238a8d9e958f874f12b
(cherry picked from commit 1a2a71baf3904209679fc5448814a0e7940fe44d)
"}]
commit_message:
SRIOV: don't block report_state with device count

The device count process can be quite slow on a system with
lots of interfaces. Doing this during report_state can block
it long enough that the agent will be reported as dead and
bindings will fail.

This adjusts the logic to only update the configuration during
the normal device retrieval for the scan loop. This will leave
the report_state loop unblocked by the operation so the agent
doesn't get reported as dead (which blocks port binding).

Closes-Bug: #1648206
Change-Id: Iff45fb6617974b1eceeed238a8d9e958f874f12b
(cherry picked from commit 1a2a71baf3904209679fc5448814a0e7940fe44d)

The device count process can be quite slow on a system with
lots of interfaces. Doing this during report_state can block

bindings will fail.

This adjusts the logic to only update the configuration during
the normal device retrieval for the scan loop. This will leave
the report_state loop unblocked by the operation so the agent
doesn't get reported as dead (which blocks port binding).

Closes-Bug: #1648206
Change-Id: Iff45fb6617974b1eceeed238a8d9e958f874f12b
(cherry picked from commit 1a2a71baf3904209679fc5448814a0e7940fe44d)

commit_message:
SRIOV: don't block report_state with device count

The device count process can be quite slow on a system with
lots of interfaces. Doing this during report_state can block
it long enough that the agent will be reported as dead and
bindings will fail.

This adjusts the logic to only update the configuration during
the normal device retrieval for the scan loop. This will leave
the report_state loop unblocked by the operation so the agent
doesn't get reported as dead (which blocks port binding).

Closes-Bug: #1648206
Change-Id: Iff45fb6617974b1eceeed238a8d9e958f874f12b
(cherry picked from commit 1a2a71baf3904209679fc5448814a0e7940fe44d)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-08 11:49:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/scenario/test_qos.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_qos.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/base.py'], 'message': "Tempest tests uses only supported QoS rule types

If rule type required for QoS tempest test is not supported by current
configuration of Neutron then such test will be skipped.
For example if neutron-server is running with ML2 plugin only with openvswitch
mechanism driver loaded then tests related to MINIMUM_BANDWIDTH rule type will
be skipped because openvswitch mechanism driver don't support this kind of rule.

Change-Id: I88e59cdbd79afb5337052ba3e5aecb96c7c8ea1c
Closes-Bug: 1644097
"}]
commit_message:
Tempest tests uses only supported QoS rule types

If rule type required for QoS tempest test is not supported by current
configuration of Neutron then such test will be skipped.
For example if neutron-server is running with ML2 plugin only with openvswitch
mechanism driver loaded then tests related to MINIMUM_BANDWIDTH rule type will
be skipped because openvswitch mechanism driver don't support this kind of rule.

Change-Id: I88e59cdbd79afb5337052ba3e5aecb96c7c8ea1c
Closes-Bug: 1644097

commit_message:
Skip larger than /64 subnets in DHCP agent

Dnsmasq can't handle these in IPv6 so we need to skip them to avoid
a whole bunch of log noise caused by continual retrying of issues.

Closes-Bug: #1645616
Change-Id: I36d167506cc45731e3f500a0c59b70b1bc27590f

The default port of the MidoNet Cluster (formerly known as MidoNet API)
is now 8181 instead of 8081.

Since this parameter is configurable through the settings, the default
