commit_message:
Changes default MidoNet API port on HAProxy

The default port of the MidoNet Cluster (formerly known as MidoNet API)
is now 8181 instead of 8081.

Since this parameter is configurable through the settings, the default
value for the port has been added to the $service_ports array.

Change-Id: I2785d3109993bca0bd68077ff55cfeafbf594e19

commit_message:
Correct tempest reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an
exception occured initially instead of place where
the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ie84f409a6c91d4ccb71968472266d57dd468a42a

commit_message:
placement: API filters providers by resources

Adds the plumbing to the Placement REST API for filtering resource
providers by a set of resources. We re-use the existing
resource_providers handler in the placement API and add the single
"resources" query string parameter.

This patch moves the "allowed_filters" handling out of the
ResourceProviderList object and into the REST API handler, using a
JSONSchema object to provider the validation to match what is done for
the POST/PUT requests.

Change-Id: I2631f23f6110d131350513188cc8ac2224892cc4
blueprint: resource-providers-get-by-request

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-07 17:38:31.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Add status_code to RESTful exceptions

tempest.lib rest_client translates a error response to the
corresponding exception, but these exceptions don't have some
attribute which shows the original status code.
This patch adds that to them for re-using the original code
after exceptions happen.

Partially implements blueprint bug-notification-decorator

Change-Id: Icfa90a5e5f1991d9b1dbc781bd60850b5bcb041e
"}]
commit_message:
Add status_code to RESTful exceptions

tempest.lib rest_client translates a error response to the
corresponding exception, but these exceptions don't have some
attribute which shows the original status code.
This patch adds that to them for re-using the original code
after exceptions happen.

Partially implements blueprint bug-notification-decorator

Change-Id: Icfa90a5e5f1991d9b1dbc781bd60850b5bcb041e

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 02:43:41.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/base.py', 'novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/v2/servers.py', 'novaclient/v2/security_groups.py', 'novaclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I6289f46344876d19d9a6793875f896cedc85a01c
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I6289f46344876d19d9a6793875f896cedc85a01c

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-12-09 18:25:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_connection_switch.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_context.py'], 'message': "Setup CellsV2 environment in base test

This makes us automatically set up a usable CellsV2 environment in
the base test case, if we're setting up database stuff. If the test
uses the DB normally, we get a cell0, a real cell, and create
hostmappings for any compute services that we start. If we're not
a DB-using test, we mock out the cell mapping stuff so that
everything appears to just be in the same cell.

This includes a fix for the nova-manage tests, which need to control
their own cells destiny now.

This includes a fix to the pci tests for libvirt, which were starting
the same compute service twice in a row. That no longer works because
we fail to create the duplicate hostmapping record, but we should not
have been doing that anyway. This makes us only create it once.

This includes a fix to the connection switching test to set up the

Change-Id: I435bf18ab66ad1469c03f0cf3027033a5751af6f
"}]
commit_message:
Setup CellsV2 environment in base test

This makes us automatically set up a usable CellsV2 environment in
the base test case, if we're setting up database stuff. If the test
uses the DB normally, we get a cell0, a real cell, and create
hostmappings for any compute services that we start. If we're not
a DB-using test, we mock out the cell mapping stuff so that
everything appears to just be in the same cell.

This includes a fix for the nova-manage tests, which need to control
their own cells destiny now.

This includes a fix to the pci tests for libvirt, which were starting
the same compute service twice in a row. That no longer works because
we fail to create the duplicate hostmapping record, but we should not
have been doing that anyway. This makes us only create it once.

This includes a fix to the connection switching test to set up the
database fixtures itself since it requires a specific environment
that we now confuse by always going through the CellDatabases fixture.

Change-Id: I435bf18ab66ad1469c03f0cf3027033a5751af6f

commit_message:
Add counters pre/post gate test hooks

We want to collect these counters for general consumption in a limited
number of places with code that has a reasonable chance of being merged.
So, on successful gate runs, we add a subunit attachment which shows the
delta for things like mysql counters and rabbitMQ messages published.
The subunit2sql worker then reads these and pushes them into statsd.

Change-Id: I5deb0e536243f607a52e34c1fd18d86c116979b0
Implements: bp counter-inspection
Depends-On: Iddb1fe50f2cf633e10e9fd1c92cef0de46ceba93

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-01 00:50:27.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/fix_disk_layout.sh'], 'message': "Add fix_disk_layout script and builder

This is the fix_disk_layout function taken out of functions.sh from
devstack-gate verbatim.
This function ensures that VMs used in jobs all have 8GB of swap
and thus, it shouldn't be devstack-specific.
Other projects could definitely use it to ensure the virtual
machines they run their jobs on consistent specifications.

Change-Id: If0721d10fa140bb1b73f3e6955aaea8b283a5333
"}]
commit_message:
Add fix_disk_layout script and builder

This is the fix_disk_layout function taken out of functions.sh from
devstack-gate verbatim.
This function ensures that VMs used in jobs all have 8GB of swap
and thus, it shouldn't be devstack-specific.
Other projects could definitely use it to ensure the virtual
machines they run their jobs on consistent specifications.

Change-Id: If0721d10fa140bb1b73f3e6955aaea8b283a5333

haven't checked that the voting tests in this chagne actually work on
xenial. Second all of these new ubuntu-trusty jobs will stop running on

Change-Id: I9519f7b09696a11f3d6da2b98a161c94b3c799f8
"}]
commit_message:
Broken xenialing

Note this should not merge because its broken for several reasons. First
haven't checked that the voting tests in this chagne actually work on
xenial. Second all of these new ubuntu-trusty jobs will stop running on
newton/master. This illustrates why making the migration to xenial this
way is difficult given this idiom in use for defining many different
types of jobs using a single job template.

Change-Id: I9519f7b09696a11f3d6da2b98a161c94b3c799f8

subject: Add json_plugin: simple way to post metrics to Monasca
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@gmail.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 1706, 'name': 'Tom Hancock', 'email': 'tom.hancock@hp.com', 'username': 'tom-hancock'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 5559, 'name': 'gui maluf balzana', 'display_name': 'Gui Maluf Balzana', 'email': 'guilherme.balzana@canonical.com', 'username': 'guimalufb'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 11809, 'name': 'Craig Bryant', 'email': 'craig.bryant@hpe.com', 'username': 'craig-bryant'}, {'_account_id': 16168, 'name': 'Tomasz Trębski', 'email': 'kornicameister@gmail.com', 'username': 'trebskit'}, {'_account_id': 20033, 'name': 'Artur Basiak', 'email': 'artur.basiak@ts.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'abasiak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-09 14:05:10.000000000', 'files': ['tests/detection/test_json_plugin.py', 'monasca_setup/detection/plugins/json_plugin.py', 'docs/Plugins.md', 'tests/checks_d/test_json_plugin.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/json_plugin.py', 'conf.d/json_plugin.yaml.example'], 'message': "Add json_plugin: simple way to post metrics to Monasca

This patch adds a plugin that reads metrics from JSON files. This
makes it very easy to integrate with Monasca -- instead of writing
a new plugin, simply write your metrics to a file.

The advantage of this mechanism is that:
- It's simple and easy to understand
- It is asynchronous with Monasca Agent. There are two technical
  advantages to this:
    - Your check does not need to run at same frequency as
      the agent.
    - If your check blocks, this does not affect other checks
      in the agent because the agent is not blocked.
- You can create the metrics as a side effect of doing other
  stuff. For example, a server process can write the JSON
  file while it is processing requests. With the normal plugin
  architecture, you need to write code that talks to your
  server process to access the metrics.
- You can write the check code in any language.

Change-Id: I1e998fa677e16cc04d46edd46d0e6433131825e7
"}]
commit_message:
Add json_plugin: simple way to post metrics to Monasca

This patch adds a plugin that reads metrics from JSON files. This
makes it very easy to integrate with Monasca -- instead of writing
a new plugin, simply write your metrics to a file.

The advantage of this mechanism is that:
- It's simple and easy to understand
- It is asynchronous with Monasca Agent. There are two technical
  advantages to this:
    - Your check does not need to run at same frequency as
      the agent.
    - If your check blocks, this does not affect other checks
      in the agent because the agent is not blocked.
- You can create the metrics as a side effect of doing other
  stuff. For example, a server process can write the JSON
  file while it is processing requests. With the normal plugin
  architecture, you need to write code that talks to your
  server process to access the metrics.
- You can write the check code in any language.

Change-Id: I1e998fa677e16cc04d46edd46d0e6433131825e7

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-12-08 09:51:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/servicegroup/drivers/db.py', 'nova/tests/unit/servicegroup/test_db_servicegroup.py'], 'message': "Don't use 'updated_at' to check service's status

Commit b9bae02af2168ad64d3b3d28c97c3853cee73272 introduced
'last_seen_up' to check service in Liberty. Nova use 'updated_at'
to check that before Liberty. So we can remove legacy item now.
Note: 'last_seen_up' may be null at the beginning. so we still
need 'created_at' in this case.

Change-Id: I5a273c294341027fba66a54a540182fc890522db
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use 'updated_at' to check service's status

Commit b9bae02af2168ad64d3b3d28c97c3853cee73272 introduced
'last_seen_up' to check service in Liberty. Nova use 'updated_at'
to check that before Liberty. So we can remove legacy item now.
Note: 'last_seen_up' may be null at the beginning. so we still
need 'created_at' in this case.

Change-Id: I5a273c294341027fba66a54a540182fc890522db

subject: Autospec ironic-lib mocks, fix test error string
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 21:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_deploy_utils.py'], 'message': "Autospec ironic-lib mocks, fix test error string

This is a follow up of commit ce46c43246ee05f76805b22f4656080b27c2266b.

Certain mocks were not set with autospec=True, meaning that calls to
methods or attributes of those mocks that don't exist would pass
silently. Additionally, an error string raised during incorrect test
behavior would have failed due to an incorrect use of Python's join()
method. Additional information is included in the error message now,
too.

Change-Id: I7a7621369ce909530a08eb7d86d1ebdc4c473c9e
"}]
commit_message:
Autospec ironic-lib mocks, fix test error string

This is a follow up of commit ce46c43246ee05f76805b22f4656080b27c2266b.

Certain mocks were not set with autospec=True, meaning that calls to
methods or attributes of those mocks that don't exist would pass
silently. Additionally, an error string raised during incorrect test
behavior would have failed due to an incorrect use of Python's join()
method. Additional information is included in the error message now,
too.

Change-Id: I7a7621369ce909530a08eb7d86d1ebdc4c473c9e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 14:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': "Allow setting dhcp_provider in devstack

Provide a variable IRONIC_DHCP_PROVIDER to set CONF.dhcp.dhcp_provider.
This is needed to properly configure ironicclient functional tests,
which don't deploy neutron.

commit_message:
Allow setting dhcp_provider in devstack

Provide a variable IRONIC_DHCP_PROVIDER to set CONF.dhcp.dhcp_provider.
This is needed to properly configure ironicclient functional tests,
which don't deploy neutron.

Change-Id: If601934d0c59b5dd5556336e5644832dc7564548
Partial-Bug: #1648179

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-12-07 23:00:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Get rid of DVR override of _port_has_ipv6_address

This function was added as part of [1] as a way to
prevent _find_ipv6_router_port_by_network from returning
the DVR SNAT port. However, the same thing can be
achieved by making _find_ipv6_router_port_by_network
just check that the interface matches the expected
device owner for regular router interfaces before
returning it.

This function is the last inherited function in the
DVR mixin other than _get_device_owner.
Once a solution for _get_device_owner and the
router extra attributes processing is found, all of
this code can be moved out of the mixin in to the
DVR driver.

1. Id243a4b3f30071226411ace6d12550fc099901cc

Change-Id: I9923ac41914dcf2e6f047517215e4c1c2d754db3
'}]
commit_message:
Get rid of DVR override of _port_has_ipv6_address

This function was added as part of [1] as a way to
prevent _find_ipv6_router_port_by_network from returning
the DVR SNAT port. However, the same thing can be
achieved by making _find_ipv6_router_port_by_network
just check that the interface matches the expected
device owner for regular router interfaces before
returning it.

This function is the last inherited function in the
DVR mixin other than _get_device_owner.
Once a solution for _get_device_owner and the
router extra attributes processing is found, all of
this code can be moved out of the mixin in to the
DVR driver.

1. Id243a4b3f30071226411ace6d12550fc099901cc

Change-Id: I9923ac41914dcf2e6f047517215e4c1c2d754db3

The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

commit_message:
Fix default value of "ignore_req_list" config option

If audit is enabled ironic API service does not start with default
value (None) of "ignore_req_list" config option. This patch changes
default value to empty string. Related modification added to ironic
sample config.

Closes-Bug: 1648387
Change-Id: Ifbbbed4012670b4b05fcf63e5586024f3c927875

commit_message:
Add filters support to constant queries test

This allows the tests to ensure constant query behavior is observed
when passing in filters. This patch updates the port query to test
with a few different column matches.

This also fixes the test to not observe queries emitted by the quota
engine that happen as a result of a list operation right after a
create operation.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ie1eab034ad99a233888cb048319bc31107be6fa3

subject: Fix cinder_volumes is_metal override example
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 17:11:05.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/cinder-volume.yml.container.example'], 'message': 'Fix cinder_volumes is_metal override example

The example file that shows how to use an env.d file to override
the is_metal value for a service is functionally incorrect.

The file is missing the properties: dictionary level and without this
correct nesting of dictionaries, the is_metal value specified has no
effect on the inventory.

Change-Id: If73d22ff7dd6e5fec24f79217f721797effab651
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder_volumes is_metal override example

The example file that shows how to use an env.d file to override
the is_metal value for a service is functionally incorrect.

The file is missing the properties: dictionary level and without this
correct nesting of dictionaries, the is_metal value specified has no
effect on the inventory.

Change-Id: If73d22ff7dd6e5fec24f79217f721797effab651

subject: Set audisp failure options [+Docs]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-08 14:24:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-030340.rst', 'vars/common.yml', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'tasks/rhel7stig/auditd.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Set audisp failure options [+Docs]

This patch adds configurations for audisp when the disk is rull on the remote
server or when there is a network interruption between the local system and
the remote audisp server.

It also explicitly installs auditd/audisp-plugins to ensure that auditd and
the remote audisp log sender are installed on CentOS/RHEL.

Documentation is included.

Change-Id: I589ae00a70582ee3f5d48453b3c20f23752adfa6
'}]
commit_message:
Set audisp failure options [+Docs]

This patch adds configurations for audisp when the disk is rull on the remote
server or when there is a network interruption between the local system and
the remote audisp server.

It also explicitly installs auditd/audisp-plugins to ensure that auditd and
the remote audisp log sender are installed on CentOS/RHEL.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I589ae00a70582ee3f5d48453b3c20f23752adfa6

CentOS/RHEL have strict AIDE configs, but Ubuntu's configuration needs
extra configuration. This patch adds lines to the end of Ubuntu's AIDE
confgiuration to meet the requirements of RHEL-07-021600,
RHEL-07-021610, and RHEL-07-021620.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I107fa931f80d6871195027be0ed8db4105e2ddf4
"}]
commit_message:
Add AIDE checks for ACL/xattrs [+Docs]

CentOS/RHEL have strict AIDE configs, but Ubuntu's configuration needs
extra configuration. This patch adds lines to the end of Ubuntu's AIDE
confgiuration to meet the requirements of RHEL-07-021600,
RHEL-07-021610, and RHEL-07-021620.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I107fa931f80d6871195027be0ed8db4105e2ddf4

subject: Prevent extra names from being sent in port create
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-08 18:06:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_port.py', 'openstack/network/v2/port.py'], 'message': "Prevent extra names from being sent in port create

Neutron is strict in what it accepts, so
openstack.network.create_port is failing with an HttpException and
details about unrecognized attributes when setting, e.g.,
binding_vnic_type. This is because the old resource class, which network
is currently based on, didn't transform binding_vnic_type into
binding:vnic_type, it just sent both of them.

While https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364052 will solve this in the
long term by transitioning to resource2, where we don't have this sort
of problem with sending extra names, we would need to wait for it and
all other related changes to merge and also be released, so I'd prefer
to make this small change that will tie us over until that larger effort
is completed. This shouldn't affect that change much as this is just
adding an extra method on the Port class, not changing anything else in
the prop names.

Change-Id: I235d129f6caf640b6fe9a657f9b9f6e505a73d68
Closes-Bug: 1625579
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent extra names from being sent in port create

Neutron is strict in what it accepts, so
openstack.network.create_port is failing with an HttpException and
details about unrecognized attributes when setting, e.g.,
binding_vnic_type. This is because the old resource class, which network
is currently based on, didn't transform binding_vnic_type into
binding:vnic_type, it just sent both of them.

While https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364052 will solve this in the
long term by transitioning to resource2, where we don't have this sort
of problem with sending extra names, we would need to wait for it and
all other related changes to merge and also be released, so I'd prefer
to make this small change that will tie us over until that larger effort
is completed. This shouldn't affect that change much as this is just
adding an extra method on the Port class, not changing anything else in
the prop names.

Change-Id: I235d129f6caf640b6fe9a657f9b9f6e505a73d68
Closes-Bug: 1625579

revisions:
[{'number': 30, 'created': '2016-12-02 03:08:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_db_api.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_rpcapi.py', 'cinder/objects/volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/objects/volume_attachment.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume_attachment.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Update attach_volume() with versionedobjects

We want to update both the attach_volume API and
detach_volume API to use volume versionedobjects.

There are three patches for it in the chain.

- Update attach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update detach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update test cases related to attach_volume()
  and detach_volume() in file
  cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py

This patch updates attach_volume API to use
volume versionedobjects.  Changes were made to
be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: lisali <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

Change-Id: I0ef693a9c3d72349563e7199aa27a0724f98a774
'}]
commit_message:
Update attach_volume() with versionedobjects

We want to update both the attach_volume API and
detach_volume API to use volume versionedobjects.

There are three patches for it in the chain.

- Update attach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update detach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update test cases related to attach_volume()
  and detach_volume() in file
  cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py

This patch updates attach_volume API to use
volume versionedobjects.  Changes were made to
be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: lisali <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

Change-Id: I0ef693a9c3d72349563e7199aa27a0724f98a774

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-05 13:44:56.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/object_storage/base.py'], 'message': "Add sleep(2) when try to delete a container

Even though in devstack this test pass successfully, the same
don't happen in HA deployment. It takes a few seconds to
synchronize the deletion of the objects between the controllers
in order to delete the container. Without this time this test
fails consistently in tripleo as you can see in the logs at
http://bit.ly/2gMDl8d.
Adding the sleep makes the HA proxy have enough time to sync
the deletion of the objects, and the container is deleted
successfully.

Change-Id: I76f6493d1429166bef9804f2fbf2acdc02425489
"}]
commit_message:
Add sleep(2) when try to delete a container

Even though in devstack this test pass successfully, the same
don't happen in HA deployment. It takes a few seconds to
synchronize the deletion of the objects between the controllers
in order to delete the container. Without this time this test
fails consistently in tripleo as you can see in the logs at
http://bit.ly/2gMDl8d.
Adding the sleep makes the HA proxy have enough time to sync
the deletion of the objects, and the container is deleted
successfully.

Change-Id: I76f6493d1429166bef9804f2fbf2acdc02425489

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 20:02:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_sriov_nic_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/sriov_nic_agent.py'], 'message': "SRIOV: don't block report_state with device count

The device count process can be quite slow on a system with
lots of interfaces. Doing this during report_state can block
it long enough that the agent will be reported as dead and
bindings will fail.

This adjusts the logic to only update the configuration during
the normal device retrieval for the scan loop. This will leave
the report_state loop unblocked by the operation so the agent
doesn't get reported as dead (which blocks port binding).

Closes-Bug: #1648206
Change-Id: Iff45fb6617974b1eceeed238a8d9e958f874f12b
"}]
commit_message:
SRIOV: don't block report_state with device count

The device count process can be quite slow on a system with
lots of interfaces. Doing this during report_state can block
it long enough that the agent will be reported as dead and
bindings will fail.

This adjusts the logic to only update the configuration during
the normal device retrieval for the scan loop. This will leave
the report_state loop unblocked by the operation so the agent
doesn't get reported as dead (which blocks port binding).

Closes-Bug: #1648206
Change-Id: Iff45fb6617974b1eceeed238a8d9e958f874f12b

commit_message:
Move get_instance() calls from try-except block

common.get_instance() raises a single exception HTTPNotFound only,
so it is not necessary to call the method in try-except block on
these cases.
This patch moves these calls from the block so that we will be
able to avoid digging what exceptions are raised on the method in
the future (On Ie1fc20fe5e028dd53116d5549814442232ddfe49 review,
we faced such situation).

Change-Id: I7c3898f79dfdd069c52de9327b7f5ec45786c8d6

subject: Remove dict-compat from the image object
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-09 09:23:42.000000000', 'files': ['zun/objects/image.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/images.py'], 'message': "Remove dict-compat from the image object

This patch removes the need of having dictcompat from
the image object. Luckily we have around 5 objects in
zun that would need this changes.

DictCompat is not really needed, since that's the old
way of referencing an object field just like a dictionary
object in python.

Currently a better way needs to be implemented to avoid
conversion of the image object to a dict
back and forth. This could be achieved if we implement
the API validation blueprint.

Change-Id: Ia0f5a4415b70934e7d47d77594f0d43ae6cb65bc
Partially-Implements: blueprint rm-object-dict-compat
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dict-compat from the image object

This patch removes the need of having dictcompat from
the image object. Luckily we have around 5 objects in
zun that would need this changes.

DictCompat is not really needed, since that's the old
way of referencing an object field just like a dictionary
object in python.

Currently a better way needs to be implemented to avoid
conversion of the image object to a dict
back and forth. This could be achieved if we implement
the API validation blueprint.

Change-Id: Ia0f5a4415b70934e7d47d77594f0d43ae6cb65bc
Partially-Implements: blueprint rm-object-dict-compat

commit_message:
Ensure correct VPNaaS package is installed

Trusty uses `openswan` and Xenial uses `strongswan`. This patch
ensures that the correct packages are installed in each distro
if the deployer chooses to deploy VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Iab6ed9cb24e07005cf6334253677689b68e344a5
Closes-Bug: #1645396
(cherry picked from commit c1c28c65a54445ee27c778866ec8edcf5df367cd)

subject: wait after killing polling thread
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-10 02:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datasources/test_datasource_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': 'wait after killing polling thread

There may be a period of time when the polling
thread is still active and attempts to interact with
a no longer existing datasource driver, leading to errors.

The errors that interrupt the stdout/stderr of a subsequent
test appears to be responsible for the occasional subunit
parser checksum errors not resolved by this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408439/

Change-Id: I5b0e17da12e564911f2341e7121b3672c00e27eb
'}]
commit_message:
wait after killing polling thread

There may be a period of time when the polling
thread is still active and attempts to interact with
a no longer existing datasource driver, leading to errors.

The errors that interrupt the stdout/stderr of a subsequent
test appears to be responsible for the occasional subunit
parser checksum errors not resolved by this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408439/

Change-Id: I5b0e17da12e564911f2341e7121b3672c00e27eb

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-08 22:12:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_dvr_mac_db.py'], 'message': 'Fix some slow unit tests

- patch DB retry count for tests excercising retry decorator.

  CPU time lost to them.
- Adjust vsctl_timeout down on ofport retry test.
  This one was taking up to 10 seconds with the default timeout.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Iabe99c06abde81ced7e8dfa48bfe8b066c59ce70
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some slow unit tests

- patch DB retry count for tests excercising retry decorator.
  These tests were taking 40 seconds per run (one used by 4 classes)
  by going through the full retry count with backoff. ~240 seconds of
  CPU time lost to them.
- Adjust vsctl_timeout down on ofport retry test.
  This one was taking up to 10 seconds with the default timeout.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Iabe99c06abde81ced7e8dfa48bfe8b066c59ce70

commit_message:
Only send string values to OVSDB other_config column

The other_config columns in OVSDB are defined as maps with string
keys and string values. The OVS agent was passing an integer
segmentation id and could pass None as the physical_network.
Unfortunately, the upstream Python OVS library does not pass the
exceptions through to us.

Change-Id: Iafa6be3749b1ee863f5fa71150c708fc46951510
Closes-Bug: #1630920
(cherry picked from commit 3d500d36608e83d202c1a6c8438ea5961a7debe1)

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-12-07 16:39:26.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fip-janitor-53f0d42a7471c5ed.yaml', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Add janitor to cleanup orphaned fip ports

This adds a janitor worker to the L3 DB module that
will run every 5 minutes looking for floating IP ports
with the device_id of 'PENDING'. If it finds any, it
will keep track of the port ID to see if any stay in
'PENDING' with the next iteration.

If the device ID is still PENDING after 5 minutes, it
means one of two things has happened. Either the server
died after creating the floating IP port, but before
creating the floating IP itself; or, it died after creating
the floating IP port and the floating IP record, but before
updating the device_id of the floating IP port to the
floating IP ID.

The janitor handles both cases by deleting the floating IP
port if it has no associated floating IP and by updating
the floating IP port device ID if it does have an associated
floating IP.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Closes-Bug: #1648098
Change-Id: I684a822553a5a0c54513ca7d20ccaf3c74180593
"}]
commit_message:
Add janitor to cleanup orphaned fip ports

This adds a janitor worker to the L3 DB module that
will run every 5 minutes looking for floating IP ports
with the device_id of 'PENDING'. If it finds any, it
will keep track of the port ID to see if any stay in
'PENDING' with the next iteration.

If the device ID is still PENDING after 5 minutes, it
means one of two things has happened. Either the server
died after creating the floating IP port, but before
creating the floating IP itself; or, it died after creating
the floating IP port and the floating IP record, but before
updating the device_id of the floating IP port to the
floating IP ID.

The janitor handles both cases by deleting the floating IP
port if it has no associated floating IP and by updating
the floating IP port device ID if it does have an associated
floating IP.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Closes-Bug: #1648098
Change-Id: I684a822553a5a0c54513ca7d20ccaf3c74180593

commit_message:
Don't pass any --config-file arguments to neutron-db-manage

The plugin config file is not needed since Juno because now schema does
not depend on plugin used; and oslo.config is capable of finding
neutron.conf by the virtue of its auto-discovery mechanism.

Change-Id: Icc4de9824ef95781a1d060534973c2bbf8e03059

commit_message:
Fix python version to 2.7 for docs

Fedora 25 recently moved to python3 as the default python version.

Trying to build docs errors on Fedora 25 during the venv build
due to feedformatter not being Py3 clean.  feedformatter is a
dependency of yasfb, making yasfb py27 only.

Change-Id: Iabf51bf9d576eb0794b1d06c641400a79a00ce23

commit_message:
Have gate wait for dns ready

Kubernetes does not seem to properly set the Ready state on dns being
usable. This seems to be causing intermittent failures in the gate.
This ps adds a test to ensure dns is responsive on all nodes before
continuing.

Change-Id: I9e871c041dbdda6dac74c1cb283787550887237c

subject: Add NIC config for compute role for DVR with multiple NICs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 18:15:25.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/multiple-nics/compute-dvr.yaml'], 'message': "Add NIC config for compute role for DVR with multiple NICs

This change adds a NIC config to the multiple-nics sample NIC
config templates for a compute node running DVR. In order for
DVR to work on the compute nodes, they must share an external
bridge with the controllers. All of the other sample NIC
configs already have an external bridge (defaults to 'br-ex'),
but the multiple-nics compute role does not, so now the
compute-dvr.yaml NIC template will demonstrate DVR with
multiple NICs.

Change-Id: I80fe2e5842a67984e1d4d8aa295c7607c4f340ad
"}]
commit_message:
Add NIC config for compute role for DVR with multiple NICs

This change adds a NIC config to the multiple-nics sample NIC
config templates for a compute node running DVR. In order for
DVR to work on the compute nodes, they must share an external
bridge with the controllers. All of the other sample NIC
configs already have an external bridge (defaults to 'br-ex'),
but the multiple-nics compute role does not, so now the
compute-dvr.yaml NIC template will demonstrate DVR with
multiple NICs.

Change-Id: I80fe2e5842a67984e1d4d8aa295c7607c4f340ad

commit_message:
Remove magnum from shade's gate

The magnum devstack plugin landed a change to disable swift. That
breaks shade's swift tests which tests functionality essential for Infra
production.

Turn off magnum support for now. We can revert this when the magnum
devstack plugin works again.

Change-Id: Iee92cb3e386651fb5a9669c3cf0bdedf1326d8b1

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

subject: Fix cinder_volumes is_metal override example
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 11:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/cinder-volume.yml.container.example'], 'message': 'Fix cinder_volumes is_metal override example

The example file that shows how to use an env.d file to override
the is_metal value for a service is functionally incorrect.

The file is missing the properties: dictionary level and without this
correct nesting of dictionaries, the is_metal value specified has no
effect on the inventory.

Change-Id: If73d22ff7dd6e5fec24f79217f721797effab651
(cherry picked from commit fb8cb1614c0e9bf5bfd97972012d5e9ce1efdc03)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder_volumes is_metal override example

The example file that shows how to use an env.d file to override
the is_metal value for a service is functionally incorrect.

The file is missing the properties: dictionary level and without this
correct nesting of dictionaries, the is_metal value specified has no
effect on the inventory.

Change-Id: If73d22ff7dd6e5fec24f79217f721797effab651

commit_message:
Add validator for device owner

Currently it is possible to assign multiple
gateway ports to a router. This patch add a validator
to prevent this behavior and also allow for any further
validations based on the device owners.

Change-Id: I1a42576f183271ad04f62b0b8ab25a813fd3b2cf
Partial-Bug: #1430345

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 18:09:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/client_config.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Defer auth prompting until it is actually needed

Auth option prompting happens waaaay to early in the default
os-client-config flow, we need to defer it until adter the commands
have been parsed.  This is why ClientManager.setup_auth() exists,
as it is not called until the first attempt to connect to a server
occurs.  Commands that do not require authentication never hit this.

Also, required options were not being enforced.  By doing this we handle
when no authentication info is present, we fail on missing auth-url rather
than attempt to prompt for a password (default auth is password).

Closes-Bug: 1619274
Change-Id: Ia4eae350e6904c9eb2c8507d9b3429fe52418726
(cherry picked from commit 14dbfe44741b65c9e0514a34669f52de8629b1c0)
'}]
commit_message:
Defer auth prompting until it is actually needed

Auth option prompting happens waaaay to early in the default
os-client-config flow, we need to defer it until adter the commands
have been parsed.  This is why ClientManager.setup_auth() exists,
as it is not called until the first attempt to connect to a server
occurs.  Commands that do not require authentication never hit this.

Also, required options were not being enforced.  By doing this we handle
when no authentication info is present, we fail on missing auth-url rather
than attempt to prompt for a password (default auth is password).

Closes-Bug: 1619274
Change-Id: Ia4eae350e6904c9eb2c8507d9b3429fe52418726
(cherry picked from commit 14dbfe44741b65c9e0514a34669f52de8629b1c0)

If the services are disabled in the devstack/settings file, it disables
them for everyone who uses the magnum devstack plugin. Some people (like
shade) use both magnum and swift to test things. Putting this in the
gate hook means it's used in all of magnum's jobs, but not in other
people's jobs.

Change-Id: Icd82a4ab68533f39f967575c2125b0f61c70e0a6

commit_message:
Disable horizon, ceilomter and swift in gate hook

If the services are disabled in the devstack/settings file, it disables
them for everyone who uses the magnum devstack plugin. Some people (like
shade) use both magnum and swift to test things. Putting this in the
gate hook means it's used in all of magnum's jobs, but not in other
people's jobs.

Change-Id: Icd82a4ab68533f39f967575c2125b0f61c70e0a6

commit_message:
Add support of endpoint_type and region_name to clients manila uses

Since change [1] it is impossible to set endpoint_type and region_name
for nova, cinder and neutron clients that are used by manila in some
cases.
So, to fix it, add additional options called 'endpoint_type' and
'region_name' for each of config groups related to these clients.
These options can be defined in appropriate config group as following:

[nova]
endpoint_type = publicURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[cinder]
endpoint_type = internalURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[neutron]
endpoint_type = adminURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d

Change-Id: I6be0e77bbc0e4b1e9905eba7a7b48ff540e9e377
Closes-Bug: #1633454
(cherry picked from commit 11b38f3188686368412cdbb22ef55570720e3002)

commit_message:
Remove Unneeded API Calls, Functions

Removed get_object call making a Nova API call.

instance_id is already passed into the view, thus making
the server_get not needed since snapshot_create only needs
the name of the snapshot and instance_id.

Removed get test case since there is no possibility of an except
being thrown from failed API call.

Change-Id: I6c1324ee4c703d01d861408f68eea2eaaf2ca901

commit_message:
Attach rework V2

*********** For illustration purposes only ***********

This is just a quick hack to share with an alternate approach
to the attach flow in Cinder.  It's not tested, doesn't have
a nova branch yet, and likely has some holes in it.

The purpose however is to contrast condensing init/attach and
term/detach (V2 attach flow proposal) and a less dramatic change
that for the most part just cleans up the flow we already have,
gets rid of all the crazy ``if this-param: elif that-param...``

This approach tries to simplify things, store a connector and access
records strictly by attachment_id.  This also would take previous
ideas around how to do multi-attach and clean them up making it
easier to achieve that goal.

Change-Id: Idd29008fd67c94e73f400165595d9700f37ceb01

commit_message:
Add new attach/detach API calls

******* WIP *********

This patch adds the cooresponding calls of the Cinder
'add new atttach/detach API calls' to the client.

These include:
1. create_attachment
2. remove_attachment
3. list_attachments

We also added create/remove and list attachments to the cli.

Depends-On: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b

Change-Id: Ib4d229778b9f691ae86fca50059cca4c0958fcf8

[{'number': 22, 'created': '2016-10-09 00:22:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/fake_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'etc/cinder/policy.json', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/085_add_attachment_specs.py', 'cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/functional/test_attach.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Add new attach/detach API calls

****** WIP *********
TODO:
1. Add the ack on connect/disconnect option for Nova
2. Unit tests
3. List/Get/Update Attachments
4. Figure out why os-brick/privsep pukes on unshelve
****** WIP *********

Latest modifications:
----------------------
10/6/16
  Added the no-connect flag to deal with attaching to
  shelved instances.  Uses an update_attachment to update
  and perform the connection on unshelve, also fixes the
  problem of detaching from a shelved instance that was
  never unshelved
---------------------

This patch aims to make the attach/detach process a bit
simpler and less prone to race conditions and solve
some confusion in it's usage.

For the first step we aren't implementing much, just
some new calls for attach and detach.  We'll call them
create/remove_attachment for now, and they'll just consolidate
all of the calls we used to make.

For example, instead of:
 1. reserve
 2. initialize
 3. attach

We'll just call create_attachment(volume, connector,
                                  instance_uuid, mountpoint)

For now that will simply call the existing initialize_connection
and attach methods, but the advantage here is it's a single call
for the consumer, and more importantly we can require all of the
various info we need up front.  This solves things like
multi-attach problems, because now we have all the info from
initialize, when we make the call to attach.

Eventually the old steps should be reimplemented and made more
efficient than they are currently, but if we get past this first
step we can have a stable, easy to use API to work off of that
shouldn't have to change AND best of all we don't break any
compatability.

Change-Id: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b
"}]
commit_message:
Add new attach/detach API calls

****** WIP *********
TODO:
1. Add the ack on connect/disconnect option for Nova
2. Unit tests
3. List/Get/Update Attachments
4. Figure out why os-brick/privsep pukes on unshelve
****** WIP *********

Latest modifications:
----------------------
10/6/16
  Added the no-connect flag to deal with attaching to
  shelved instances.  Uses an update_attachment to update
  and perform the connection on unshelve, also fixes the
  problem of detaching from a shelved instance that was
  never unshelved
---------------------

This patch aims to make the attach/detach process a bit
simpler and less prone to race conditions and solve
some confusion in it's usage.

For the first step we aren't implementing much, just
some new calls for attach and detach.  We'll call them
create/remove_attachment for now, and they'll just consolidate
all of the calls we used to make.

For example, instead of:
 1. reserve
 2. initialize
 3. attach

We'll just call create_attachment(volume, connector,
                                  instance_uuid, mountpoint)

For now that will simply call the existing initialize_connection
and attach methods, but the advantage here is it's a single call
for the consumer, and more importantly we can require all of the
various info we need up front.  This solves things like
multi-attach problems, because now we have all the info from
initialize, when we make the call to attach.

Eventually the old steps should be reimplemented and made more
efficient than they are currently, but if we get past this first
step we can have a stable, easy to use API to work off of that
shouldn't have to change AND best of all we don't break any
compatability.

Change-Id: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b

commit_message:
HAProxy - Add host routes to the lbaas namespace

This change adds a loop through the subnet host routes and
if any of this routes have the destination different from
0.0.0.0/0, adds it to the lbaas namespace.

Change-Id: I08cd006faed2291d731768d71149d07592bce301
Closes-Bug: #1635355
(cherry picked from commit 4a708bfce90e50018a74f3c69a5115458d4c7dcb)

commit_message:
HAProxy - Add host routes to the lbaas namespace

This change adds a loop through the subnet host routes and
if any of this routes have the destination different from
0.0.0.0/0, adds it to the lbaas namespace.

Change-Id: I08cd006faed2291d731768d71149d07592bce301
Closes-Bug: #1635355
(cherry picked from commit 4a708bfce90e50018a74f3c69a5115458d4c7dcb)

commit_message:
[proxy-api] microversion 2.39 deprecates image-metadata proxy API

Almost all proxy APIs were deprecated in microversion 2.36.
But the sub-resource image-metadata of image was forgotten to deprecate.
This patch deprecates the image-metdata API from 2.39.

Implements blueprint deprecate-image-meta-proxy-api
Closes-bug: #1614578

Change-Id: I5507337ab6fe4a377f66dec3fe275d75618cd7b4

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-08 09:23:40.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/api/test_datasource_model.py', 'congress/tests/test_congress.py', 'congress/tests/dse2/test_dse2.py'], 'message': 'gate-issue: Update tests to use fake clients

commit_message:
gate-issue: Update tests to use fake clients

IndexError: list index out of range errors are seen while
executing py27 jobs as tests try to connect to real client
instead of fake ones while polling. This commit fixes the same.

Closes-Bug:#1648320
Change-Id: Ieb42e8265a6ada95a3430a3f78a01806f714be0e

commit_message:
Added retries in db_sync for nova_api db

That patch continue fixes made for LP#1628580
If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: Ie718efef81a24d0299fff83d39d04fac5a36fbb0
Related-Bug: #1628580
Related-Bug: #1647305
Closes-Bug: #1645474

subject: [extensions] cache discovered extensions
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-04-20 13:31:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/shell.rst', 'novaclient/extension.py', 'novaclient/client.py'], 'message': '[extensions] cache discovered extensions

There are several OpenStack projects which use novaclient multiple times.
Each time new instance of novaclient is created and each time method
discover_extensions is called.

`discover_extensions` can take some "real" time to discover extensions via
python path and entry points. To reduce this time, let's cache the results.
To make it possible, we need to make novaclient.extension.Extension pickable.

Change-Id: Iec2321f7e2814a6ee09f4dd64ea630ddc714e30c
'}]
commit_message:
[extensions] cache discovered extensions

There are several OpenStack projects which use novaclient multiple times.
Each time new instance of novaclient is created and each time method
discover_extensions is called.

`discover_extensions` can take some "real" time to discover extensions via
python path and entry points. To reduce this time, let's cache the results.
To make it possible, we need to make novaclient.extension.Extension pickable.

Change-Id: Iec2321f7e2814a6ee09f4dd64ea630ddc714e30c

use the current tenant and user.

Closes-Bug: #1337990

subject: Add option to disable local disks in flavors
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-21 07:03:06.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/__init__.py', 'novaclient/v2/flavors.py'], 'message': 'Add option to disable local disks in flavors

This feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disk locally on the hypervisor;
A new boolean argument '--local-disks' for flavor-create is added.
If local-disks is set to False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.
All blockdevice mappings with dest_type local will be disallowed
with such flavors.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I99bbf9b29100813609a62aa925600bc6bd4ba9c0
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to disable local disks in flavors

This feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disk locally on the hypervisor;
A new boolean argument '--local-disks' for flavor-create is added.
If local-disks is set to False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.
All blockdevice mappings with dest_type local will be disallowed
with such flavors.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I99bbf9b29100813609a62aa925600bc6bd4ba9c0
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

subject: Add tenant_name when list nova usage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-10 11:42:10.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/v2/fakes.py', 'novaclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add tenant_name when list nova usage

In openstack dashboard, when we click on admin -->overview,
It gives us overview of usage summary page. In that page,
we are able to see project name (i.e tenant name).

But in nova usage list command, we are getting tenant id not tenant name.
So the point is that along with tenant id, tenant name
should also be added as similar as in GUI page.

Closes-Bug: #1318770
Change-Id: Ibb556da5985f21aa1398cdb6fd69aaf03123b62c
'}]
commit_message:
Add tenant_name when list nova usage

In openstack dashboard, when we click on admin -->overview,
It gives us overview of usage summary page. In that page,
we are able to see project name (i.e tenant name).

But in nova usage list command, we are getting tenant id not tenant name.
So the point is that along with tenant id, tenant name
should also be added as similar as in GUI page.

Closes-Bug: #1318770
Change-Id: Ibb556da5985f21aa1398cdb6fd69aaf03123b62c

commit_message:
flavor postional argument in nova boot help

The help for boot specifies flavor as a
optional parameter, where as running the
command without a flavor results in an
error. So corrected the help to include
flavor in the positional parameter list.

Change-Id: Ie98d340044a86049f6201b2980ad2c93518038dd
Closes-Bug: #1415319

commit_message:
not use cert and private key in glance client

nova connect to glance https server don't need cert
and private key file, a ca file should be enough

Change-Id: I85f7f71e5fa121e9d9524cf46e50d30959945026
Closes-Bug: 1612644

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 20:31:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "test_db_api: optimize ArchiveTestCase

Avoid using of schema reflection when we don't really need it (we
already have this data in SQLAlchemy metadata produced from model
definitions). In other cases we can only reflect only the pieces we
need, like table table names instead of full tables metadata.

It's not crucial when tests are run against an in-memory SQLite DB,
but still allows to get a short cut in CPU time and memory usage
(5.8s vs 7.5s or ~22%, ~2 MB of RAM when running only these tests
with testtools).

Change-Id: If2e71577832552177b73db4b5930b8114a07aebc
"}]
commit_message:
test_db_api: optimize ArchiveTestCase

Avoid using of schema reflection when we don't really need it (we
already have this data in SQLAlchemy metadata produced from model
definitions). In other cases we can only reflect only the pieces we
need, like table table names instead of full tables metadata.

It's not crucial when tests are run against an in-memory SQLite DB,
but still allows to get a short cut in CPU time and memory usage
(5.8s vs 7.5s or ~22%, ~2 MB of RAM when running only these tests
with testtools).

Change-Id: If2e71577832552177b73db4b5930b8114a07aebc

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-04-20 10:12:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/storage/test_rbd.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/storage/rbd_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt - Unrescue will not remove rescue disk when image_type=rbd

This bug happens when using libvirt/QEMU and image_type=rbd.

Rescue instance creates a rescue kernel and ramdisk disk in local.
It will also creates a rescue disk which will saved in ceph by rbd.
When users want to unrescue instance, nova will remove all rescue kernel
and ramdisk disk in local.
But rescue disk which was created in rescue step will still exist.

Because of unrescue action will remove local rescue file and lvm disk
but it didn't remove rbd disk. Therefore we need to add libvirt
images_type condition statement which will remove correct type of disk.

Change-Id: Id8693e5f1a63c400d0e90b2e4cd1251e64984ce8
Closes-Bug: 1478199
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt - Unrescue will not remove rescue disk when image_type=rbd

This bug happens when using libvirt/QEMU and image_type=rbd.

Rescue instance creates a rescue kernel and ramdisk disk in local.
It will also creates a rescue disk which will saved in ceph by rbd.
When users want to unrescue instance, nova will remove all rescue kernel
and ramdisk disk in local.
But rescue disk which was created in rescue step will still exist.

Because of unrescue action will remove local rescue file and lvm disk
but it didn't remove rbd disk. Therefore we need to add libvirt
images_type condition statement which will remove correct type of disk.

Change-Id: Id8693e5f1a63c400d0e90b2e4cd1251e64984ce8
Closes-Bug: 1478199

Use oslo.utils.reflection to get class names

This patch update the method of getting the class name with oslo
utils' reflection module.

Change-Id: Ia6e495d38b0b50bf2094302757c02c5eb69719db

subject: Improve character encoding in client messages
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 16:43:53.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/utils.py'], 'message': "Improve character encoding in client messages

This patch improves handling of the character
encoding in client success and error messages.

As noted in the closed-bug, when the name of
something, (ie an instance), is unicode,
the client doesn't handle the success and error
messages well.

Change-Id: I22c83b489f1464714b385c47c043500e0b0c3e46
Closes-Bug: #1403379
"}]
commit_message:
Improve character encoding in client messages

This patch improves handling of the character
encoding in client success and error messages.

As noted in the closed-bug, when the name of
something, (ie an instance), is unicode,
the client doesn't handle the success and error
messages well.

Change-Id: I22c83b489f1464714b385c47c043500e0b0c3e46
Closes-Bug: #1403379

commit_message:
Destroy dummy bdm when attaching volume

A dummy bdm record will be create if timeout
occurs during nova-api call nova-compute to
run reserve_block_device_name. The dummy bdm
record has a blank connection_info. The fix
will destroy the record.

Change-Id: I066e1e7b4726b87d24605866bf731803aae15feb
Closes-Bug: #1615908

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-07 03:10:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "server_group_members quota exceeded silently

The return value of objects.Quotas.count('server_group_members') was
not updated between the for-loop in _provision_instances() method,
but the number of server group members were growing, as a result,
the quota exceeded but we did not detect it.

In fact, Quotas.count() always returns 0 although InstanceGroup.add_members()
has been called many times. The reason may be that it does not update the
instance_group.members throughout the for-loop.

To fix this bug, we check server_group_members quota before the for-loop
instead of inside of it.

Change-Id: I03bec8ab9ababbc51861e54c5b8509f9d9fb923d
Closes-Bug: #1598859
"}]
commit_message:
server_group_members quota exceeded silently

The return value of objects.Quotas.count('server_group_members') was
not updated between the for-loop in _provision_instances() method,
but the number of server group members were growing, as a result,
the quota exceeded but we did not detect it.

In fact, Quotas.count() always returns 0 although InstanceGroup.add_members()
has been called many times. The reason may be that it does not update the
instance_group.members throughout the for-loop.

To fix this bug, we check server_group_members quota before the for-loop
instead of inside of it.

Change-Id: I03bec8ab9ababbc51861e54c5b8509f9d9fb923d
Closes-Bug: #1598859

commit_message:
Add option to disable local disks in flavors [3/3]

This new feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disks on the hypervisor;
A new boolean field 'local_disks' is added to flavors.
If local_disks=False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

This commit is the REST API related part of the
implementation.

Change-Id: I2533db3b08ddc66f42348135dcc2decfb5c3e861
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Replace MagicMock with Mock class

MagicMock magically allow things to pass. Any usage should be
replaced with the Mock class and explicit attributes should
be set on it.

Change-Id: I9cb81acddb54909dbcd6d65547dbd9408069f289
Closes-Bug: #1475722

commit_message:
live-migration: Update instance availability_zone

This uses availability_zones package to find instance's az info
and update database record in post_live_migration_at_destination.

Change-Id: I0884c9172c761e876373726b741ba923d36d675b
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>

commit_message:
XenAPI: add unit test for the plugin - glance

Add unit test for the xenapi plugin -glance and also add
a boolean return value to _download_tarball_and_verify
so that it's eaiser to check the result for this function.

Change-Id: Ib1a8bd455b972798f2988834de61cfce048c15f9

commit_message:
StandardError raises NameError in Python3

StandardError is not defined in Python3, it will raise  NameError in
code. This patch is to fix this bug.

Change-Id: Ic8578a5ad719b94e6216bd7adbd00613d0ece078
Closes-Bug: #1595830

commit_message:
Replace MagicMock with Mock class

MagicMock magically allow things to pass. Any usage should be
replaced with the Mock class and explicit attributes should
be set on it.

Change-Id: I89a79400b8462c3996a84c4195034db515be1162
Closes-Bug: #1475722

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-15 11:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_blockinfo.py'], 'message': 'Instance can not resize ephemeral disk

I boot an instance with an ephemeral disk, the ephemeral
is named disk.eph0. Then resize the instance, but
ephemeral disk.eph0 is not resized.

The reason is that when instance has only a ephemeral disk,
the ephemeral disk file named disk.eph0, but when resize
instance, it judgment the ephemeral disk named disk.local.
Therefore, a ephemeral disk can not be resized.

This patch update code, if only one ephemeral disk is
specified, name it as disk.local, else name them
as disk.eph0, disk.eph1, etc ...

Change-Id: Iad30e296c2b47d12fef7c65df20d96791e9bbb13
Closes-Bug: #1558880
'}]
commit_message:
Instance can not resize ephemeral disk

I boot an instance with an ephemeral disk, the ephemeral
is named disk.eph0. Then resize the instance, but
ephemeral disk.eph0 is not resized.

The reason is that when instance has only a ephemeral disk,
the ephemeral disk file named disk.eph0, but when resize
instance, it judgment the ephemeral disk named disk.local.
Therefore, a ephemeral disk can not be resized.

This patch update code, if only one ephemeral disk is
specified, name it as disk.local, else name them
as disk.eph0, disk.eph1, etc ...

Change-Id: Iad30e296c2b47d12fef7c65df20d96791e9bbb13
Closes-Bug: #1558880

commit_message:
[WIP]: Add test case for delete dangling ports on timeout.

Adding a test scenario for deleting dangling ports on timeout or
failure. When launching many instances in parallel, Nova sees timeouts
from Neutron and fails to clean the ports.

This commit includes test scenario for deleting ports. Functionality
change is addressed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347183/

Change-Id: Ibede2e3e04e302c414ffbde5c8f18627dc9bbb76
Depends-On: #347183
Partial-Bug: #1603909

commit_message:
policy: verifying forced_host's target should have context.project_id

"create:forced_host" action is enabled for the "admin_or_owner" role
by default, so here we should add the context.project_id as the target role,
rather than empty.

Change-Id: Id148938f2bc35b90531d4adec237c8ced9b7dc8e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 14:29:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/extra_specs_ops.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/aggregate_instance_extra_specs.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_extra_specs_ops.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/compute_capabilities_filter.py'], 'message': "Move extra_specs_ops to oslo.utils

Ironic needs to do some capability matching that has feature parity with
Nova's capability matching. Rather than trying to re-create it
ourselves, we've moved Nova's matching code into oslo.utils so that we
make sure it's always the same.

Change the nova code to use the code from the library.

Change-Id: Ia54f97ebc52a8099ced5b77796dbb2f0f0c63266

commit_message:
Move extra_specs_ops to oslo.utils

Ironic needs to do some capability matching that has feature parity with
Nova's capability matching. Rather than trying to re-create it
ourselves, we've moved Nova's matching code into oslo.utils so that we
make sure it's always the same.

Change the nova code to use the code from the library.

Change-Id: Ia54f97ebc52a8099ced5b77796dbb2f0f0c63266
Depends-On: I2dabb5301f8270b4431572e4689665dc739f72ea

this problem.

commit_message:
VMware - Favor shared datastores

When choosing the datastore, prefer the one with more connected hosts.
Also make sure that the choosen datastore has enough free space to hold
the image.

Fixes-Bug: #1216209
Co-author: Radoslav Gerganov
Change-Id: Ic974b92fff7ff48f12c734aed62ee4eba6cbdd41

commit_message:
libvirt/driver: armv7/aarch64 vga, serial defaults

Nova libvirt driver hardcodes default options for both video=cirrus
and serial console.

armv7 and aarch64 VMs require video=vga, and since most applications
use PL011 serial driver for guests, adding console=ttyAMA0 is also
a nice UX addition.

Change-Id: Ibb136def0ca624d192865256edcfb1131173cfdc
Signed-off-by: Stanislaw Kardach <stanislaw.kardach@caviumnetworks.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexandru Avadanii <Alexandru.Avadanii@enea.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-12 11:50:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix nova-compute service start order

    After rebooting all nodes in the cluster, all the instances that were
    running on the cluster are stuck in Status ACTIVE, Task state:
    powering-off, Power state: Crashed.

    The manager.init_host method is the one that tries to shut off the
    instances which are in state active but not running. it does so
    by RPC. But the starting of the RPC server is only done in the
    server.start method, which is called after the init_host is called.
    The RPC message never gets back to nova-compute.

    Moving the cleanup of the instances state to the post_start_hook
    function, fixes this problem.

    Change-Id: Ia01b0f63e4bc8d6b34f00346675d7f208fe805ce
    Closes-Bug: 1593186

Change-Id: I04f52582fd10bdd696189c7b2e148530f5eeb7e9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-compute service start order

    After rebooting all nodes in the cluster, all the instances that were
    running on the cluster are stuck in Status ACTIVE, Task state:
    powering-off, Power state: Crashed.

    The manager.init_host method is the one that tries to shut off the
    instances which are in state active but not running. it does so
    by RPC. But the starting of the RPC server is only done in the
    server.start method, which is called after the init_host is called.
    The RPC message never gets back to nova-compute.

    Moving the cleanup of the instances state to the post_start_hook
    function, fixes this problem.

    Change-Id: Ia01b0f63e4bc8d6b34f00346675d7f208fe805ce
    Closes-Bug: 1593186

Change-Id: I04f52582fd10bdd696189c7b2e148530f5eeb7e9

commit_message:
Add debug logging when deallocating ports

While debugging a Tempest race failure it would have
been useful to see when the ports on an instance were
deallocated, especially knowing which ports are unbound
versus which ports are deleted.

This simply adds debug logging of the ports in both
situations.

The unit tests are updated for the conditional checks
that were put into the code - which should have probably
been this way to begin with.

Change-Id: Idde18acc04967bfe73c3e869e36341ddfbbbb011

This patch implements a new class `Claim` to check resource consumption
in host states, including cpu, ram, disk, numa topology and pci. This
patch encapsulates claim logics into the new Claim inherited from
`nova.compute.claims.Claim`. Also, claim tests are implemented in
test_claims.py to make sure there are no regressions in scheduler.

This patch also ensures that no resources are consumed in the host
state if any of the claims in `HostState.consume_from_request()` fails,
and the scheduler will change to try the second best host. This process
is identical to the claim logic in the compute nodes, so that some host
failing conditions in the compute nodes can be detected as soon as
possible to prevent some expensive retries. Related tests are also
added.

Note `set_update_time_on_success` decorator is removed because the
exception handling is duplicated in `FilterScheduler._select_host()` and
the time update logic is implemented in
`HostState.consume_from_request()` in only 2 lines.

Note test_host_manager.HostStateTestCase.\
test_stat_consumption_from_instance_with_pci_exception is replaced by
test_claims.ClaimTestCase.test_claim_pci_fails because the consumption
will be checked firstly by claims in `host.consume_from_request`.

Change-Id: Iad6e447072f15ba8b71f35342ee959f677fbdbff
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking
'}]
commit_message:
Scheduler use Claim to check resource consumption

This patch implements a new class `Claim` to check resource consumption
in host states, including cpu, ram, disk, numa topology and pci. This
patch encapsulates claim logics into the new Claim inherited from
`nova.compute.claims.Claim`. Also, claim tests are implemented in
test_claims.py to make sure there are no regressions in scheduler.

This patch also ensures that no resources are consumed in the host
state if any of the claims in `HostState.consume_from_request()` fails,
and the scheduler will change to try the second best host. This process
is identical to the claim logic in the compute nodes, so that some host
failing conditions in the compute nodes can be detected as soon as
possible to prevent some expensive retries. Related tests are also
added.

Note `set_update_time_on_success` decorator is removed because the
exception handling is duplicated in `FilterScheduler._select_host()` and
the time update logic is implemented in
`HostState.consume_from_request()` in only 2 lines.

Note test_host_manager.HostStateTestCase.\
test_stat_consumption_from_instance_with_pci_exception is replaced by
test_claims.ClaimTestCase.test_claim_pci_fails because the consumption
will be checked firstly by claims in `host.consume_from_request`.

Change-Id: Iad6e447072f15ba8b71f35342ee959f677fbdbff
Partially-Implements: bp host-state-level-locking

commit_message:
Query procceeding status migration in confirm/revert_resize()

This patch adds proceeding status while query migration objects while
doing confirm/revert resize, by doing this we can re-issue this
confirm/revert operation in case of rpc message is missed after casting
to compute node.

Closes-bug: #1536703
Change-Id: I38b7585dcae39cfab15481c369950d626cc88727

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-08 01:18:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Improve scheduler host state's update model

Current update model of scheduler host state has some issues. First, a
host state cache will be updated even if it is already the same with the
latest db data(i.e. HostState.db_updated = compute.updated_at =
HostState.db_updated). Second, the cache won't be updated even if db
data is newer in a specific case(i.e. HostState.db_updated <
compute.updated_at < HostState.updated).

This patch adds a timestamp to record when a host state cache is updated
by db(HostState.db_updated), and fixes the first issue. This complete
update model covers all 6 possible conditions:
1. compute_db_updated < cache_db_updated/cache_updated   -> return
2. cache_db_updated = cache_updated = compute_db_updated -> return
3. cache_db_updated = compute_db_updated < cache_updated -> return
4. cache_db_updated < compute_db_updated < cache_updated -> return
5. cache_db_updated < compute_db_updated = cache_updated -> update
6. cache_db_updated/cache_updated < compute_db_updated   -> update

However, this patch won't fix the second issue by setting #4 to
'-> update' because it will introduce much more unexpected retries due
to the losses of recent consumptions when refresh the host state,
causing a worse impact from the bug #1341420. A detailed analysis can
be found at https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1341420/comments/24

So the second issue is left unsolved because this leads to less
consumption losses and thus can reduce retries to minimum in
'one scheduler instance per cell' scenario. It should be solved after
consumptions are instantiated by claims during host state consumption,
which will be implemented in bp host-state-level-locking.

This patch also applies to IronicNodeState.

Change-Id: I5ecbab9497d94c9e935c618ccbffb60f6019a104
Partial-Bug: #1341420
"}]
commit_message:
Improve scheduler host state's update model

Current update model of scheduler host state has some issues. First, a
host state cache will be updated even if it is already the same with the
latest db data(i.e. HostState.db_updated = compute.updated_at =
HostState.db_updated). Second, the cache won't be updated even if db
data is newer in a specific case(i.e. HostState.db_updated <
compute.updated_at < HostState.updated).

This patch adds a timestamp to record when a host state cache is updated
by db(HostState.db_updated), and fixes the first issue. This complete
update model covers all 6 possible conditions:
1. compute_db_updated < cache_db_updated/cache_updated   -> return
2. cache_db_updated = cache_updated = compute_db_updated -> return
3. cache_db_updated = compute_db_updated < cache_updated -> return
4. cache_db_updated < compute_db_updated < cache_updated -> return
5. cache_db_updated < compute_db_updated = cache_updated -> update
6. cache_db_updated/cache_updated < compute_db_updated   -> update

However, this patch won't fix the second issue by setting #4 to
'-> update' because it will introduce much more unexpected retries due
to the losses of recent consumptions when refresh the host state,
causing a worse impact from the bug #1341420. A detailed analysis can
be found at https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1341420/comments/24

So the second issue is left unsolved because this leads to less
consumption losses and thus can reduce retries to minimum in
'one scheduler instance per cell' scenario. It should be solved after
consumptions are instantiated by claims during host state consumption,
which will be implemented in bp host-state-level-locking.

This patch also applies to IronicNodeState.

Change-Id: I5ecbab9497d94c9e935c618ccbffb60f6019a104
Partial-Bug: #1341420

commit_message:
VMware: add support for VVOL datastores

Similarly to VSAN, only streamOptimized images can be provisioned on
VVOL datastores.

blueprint vmware-vvol-support

Change-Id: I021e2021c128da4db2f53a9973658a92a937bfbf

commit_message:
Make LM downtime params mutable

* libvirt.live_migration_downtime
* libvirt.live_migration_downtime_steps
* libvirt.live_migration_downtime_delay

These will immediately apply to all running live migrations.

The old code precomputed the downtime steps. Since the downtime params
are now mutable, this no longer makes sense and would lead to
convoluted code. Now we compute the next downtime on the fly.

I updated the values in the example to match the values the tests run
with (by default).

Part of bp:mutable-config-ocata

Change-Id: I379aeddf0e141a1ceccb8d107a87d35e5f8de823

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-07-14 02:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix code path when network is not cleaned up

the code path is nova/compute/manager/_do_build_and_run_instance:

    1. VM creation failed for any reason that throws RescheduledException
    2. retry is not null on the first attempt
    3. deallocate_networks_on_reschedule returns False
    4. network_api.cleanup_instance_network_on_host does nothing
      (e.g, neutronv2/api currently has a null implemnetation)

The side effect of not proper cleaning up the network is that VM would
be rescheduled to a different hypervisor with in-compatible network, causing
the VM lose connectivity

Part of the trigger for the issue is that the bridged_network is not compatible
among the candidate compute nodes on retry. The current proposed fix is to
detect the presence of immobile networks (bridge_network in this case), and if
true, call _cleanup_allocated_networks.

closes-bug: #1597596

Change-Id: Ida5a48d0e8612af639e6f4ce9fe590c798f4de51
Signed-off-by: aihuaedwardli <aihuaedwardli@yahoo.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix code path when network is not cleaned up

the code path is nova/compute/manager/_do_build_and_run_instance:

    1. VM creation failed for any reason that throws RescheduledException
    2. retry is not null on the first attempt
    3. deallocate_networks_on_reschedule returns False
    4. network_api.cleanup_instance_network_on_host does nothing
      (e.g, neutronv2/api currently has a null implemnetation)

The side effect of not proper cleaning up the network is that VM would
be rescheduled to a different hypervisor with in-compatible network, causing
the VM lose connectivity

Part of the trigger for the issue is that the bridged_network is not compatible
among the candidate compute nodes on retry. The current proposed fix is to
detect the presence of immobile networks (bridge_network in this case), and if
true, call _cleanup_allocated_networks.

closes-bug: #1597596

Change-Id: Ida5a48d0e8612af639e6f4ce9fe590c798f4de51
Signed-off-by: aihuaedwardli <aihuaedwardli@yahoo.com>
