[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-25 06:44:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Fix VMDK volume detach issue if the backing VM is unregistered

Currrently, if the backing VM is unregistered and registered back
in vCenter of an attached volume, the VMDK volume detach operation
fails. Because we are relying on the VM MOID present in the
connection_info, provided by cinder.
Due to ungistering the backing VM in vCenter, the MOID changes and the
ref created using that, will no longer be usable.

This patch addresses it by making the vCenter call explicitly by
name to get the "volume_ref".

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/344069/
Change-Id: Ie67465f9e6a72d3b2f8c082a17c1f5a759cd8431
closes-bug:1593742
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix VMDK volume detach issue if the backing VM is unregistered

Currrently, if the backing VM is unregistered and registered back
in vCenter of an attached volume, the VMDK volume detach operation
fails. Because we are relying on the VM MOID present in the
connection_info, provided by cinder.
Due to ungistering the backing VM in vCenter, the MOID changes and the
ref created using that, will no longer be usable.

This patch addresses it by making the vCenter call explicitly by
name to get the "volume_ref".

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/344069/
Change-Id: Ie67465f9e6a72d3b2f8c082a17c1f5a759cd8431
closes-bug:1593742

commit_message:
Avoid hard code for server create extensions

Use ATTRIBUTE_NAME in extensions to avoid hard code.

Change-Id: I0f7f9c01d87f86b2ca3ced16f94d10393f64827f

commit_message:
Add output of the DB calls found by DatabasePoisonFixture

With the DatabasePoisonFixture, if a test derived from
test.NoDBTestCase makes a DB call, a warning is emitted indicating
that the test is setting internal oslo_db state that would conflict
with tests that are actually using the database.

This adds an additional warning output containing the offending
DB calls to help developers fix tests.

Change-Id: I6d4b6e4b34f4ac54fb1ee3e0bdcd4580b7884c49

Lets tidy up the code because of that.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 18:30:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt/driver: direct boot with part table inject

See bug #1290455 for full bug description.

Cirros test VM image on AArch64 comes with a partition table.
Also, on AArch64, direct kernel boot is currently recommended in
favor of using AAVMF on some platforms with buggy interrupt
controllers, leading to this limitation beng triggered.

Our proposal is to test the presence of a partition table inside
the disk image by checking the <root> kernel argument.

If <root> matches "/dev/.d.([1-9]+)", we are dealing with a part.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1290455

Closes-Bug: #1290455

'}]
commit_message:
libvirt/driver: direct boot with part table inject

See bug #1290455 for full bug description.

Cirros test VM image on AArch64 comes with a partition table.
Also, on AArch64, direct kernel boot is currently recommended in
favor of using AAVMF on some platforms with buggy interrupt
controllers, leading to this limitation beng triggered.

Our proposal is to test the presence of a partition table inside
the disk image by checking the <root> kernel argument.

If <root> matches "/dev/.d.([1-9]+)", we are dealing with a part.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1290455

Change-Id: I80a1e36c2ec2afd83c3bbb77c65c52fa029e8c09
Closes-Bug: #1290455
Signed-off-by: Alexandru Avadanii <Alexandru.Avadanii@enea.com>
Signed-off-by: Stanislaw Kardach <stanislaw.kardach@caviumnetworks.com>

commit_message:
Allow "revert_resize" to recover error instance after resize/migrate

When resize/migrate instance, if error occurs on source compute
node, instance state can rollback to active currently.

But if error occurs in "finish_resize" function on destination
compute node, the instance state would not rollback to active.

This patch is to rollback instance state from error to active when
resize or migrate action failed on destination compute node..

Closes-Bug:#1396003

Change-Id: I75e7e17b882f7b25847f61168df0d8632286b1d7

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 15:49:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Correct InstanceEvent debug messages

Instance events can be sent to a compute host while it is not
currently running. When the compute manager is then started it
receives the events and attempts to handle them.  In this scenario
there will not be any waiters for the event since the manager was
just started.  The current code was sending a debug message saying
the event was received after event processing was cancelled because
it was incorrectly checking 'if not self._events:' which would be
True if self._events is either None or {}.  With None meaning
all events have been cancelled an no further events will be
handled.  This is the shutdown case.  When self._events is {},
it just means there are no waiters for the event.

This changeset adds a check for 'if self._event is None' and
sends the appropriate message only after events have been
cancelled.

Change-Id: Ia73f9a9740aa794697f3d7464eb59a6207fac61a
"}]
commit_message:
Correct InstanceEvent debug messages

Instance events can be sent to a compute host while it is not
currently running. When the compute manager is then started it
receives the events and attempts to handle them.  In this scenario
there will not be any waiters for the event since the manager was
just started.  The current code was sending a debug message saying
the event was received after event processing was cancelled because
it was incorrectly checking 'if not self._events:' which would be
True if self._events is either None or {}.  With None meaning
all events have been cancelled an no further events will be
handled.  This is the shutdown case.  When self._events is {},
it just means there are no waiters for the event.

This changeset adds a check for 'if self._event is None' and
sends the appropriate message only after events have been
cancelled.

Change-Id: Ia73f9a9740aa794697f3d7464eb59a6207fac61a

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-21 09:00:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Make sure image metadata is retained after evacuation

Example:
    boot vm-test with image that has metadata qemu-guest-agent=yes
    evacuate vm-test to test-node
    nova evacuate vm-test test-node --on-shared-storage
    post instance evacuation, the image metadata is retained

    check libvirt xml

    <channel type='unix'>
      <source mode='bind' path='/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/org.qemu.
      guest_agent.0.instance-0000006d.sock'/>
      <target type='virtio' name='org.qemu.guest_agent.0' state=

      <address type='virtio-serial' controller='0' bus='0'
      port='1'/>
    </channel>

recheck no bug

Fixes bug 1562681

Change-Id: Id74c81fae0022f2fe1c0938c7f68a53a75c37ca8
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure image metadata is retained after evacuation

Example:
    boot vm-test with image that has metadata qemu-guest-agent=yes
    evacuate vm-test to test-node
    nova evacuate vm-test test-node --on-shared-storage
    post instance evacuation, the image metadata is retained

    check libvirt xml

    <channel type='unix'>
      <source mode='bind' path='/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/org.qemu.
      guest_agent.0.instance-0000006d.sock'/>
      <target type='virtio' name='org.qemu.guest_agent.0' state=
      'connected'/>
      <alias name='channel0'/>
      <address type='virtio-serial' controller='0' bus='0'
      port='1'/>
    </channel>

recheck no bug

Fixes bug 1562681

Change-Id: Id74c81fae0022f2fe1c0938c7f68a53a75c37ca8

commit_message:
Change ignored exception in Ironic virt driver

During unprovisioning if Ironic node is already in a deprovisioned
state we should ignore InvalidStateRequested.
Ironic code reference:
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/conductor/manager.py#L595-L615

Change-Id: Ie7ed4fbce1414963dfce42f1f1ed6db644bda670

subject: Data corrupt when attaching/detaching encrypted NFS volumes

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-21 07:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume/nfs.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_nfs.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py'], 'message': "Data corrupt when attaching/detaching encrypted NFS volumes

When attaching a NFS volume, Nova returns the real file path in
connection_info['data']['device_path']. When a NFS volume is encrypted,
Nova creates a decrypted device, and let above device_path refer to the
decrypted device. As a result, the original real data file in NFS is
corrupted.

When above volume is detached, the data file in NFS is lost and data
is lost.

This patch is to add a local symbolic path which refer to real file
in NFS share folder, and return the symbolic path in connection_info.

When attaching encryptors, Nova makes the symbolic path refer to
decrypted device, and doesn't destroy real file in NFS share folder.

Change-Id: I6d2ce5e638d713eb12e5cde2e91e17df1c7263e2
Closes-bug: #1511255
"}]
commit_message:
Data corrupt when attaching/detaching encrypted NFS volumes

When attaching a NFS volume, Nova returns the real file path in
connection_info['data']['device_path']. When a NFS volume is encrypted,
Nova creates a decrypted device, and let above device_path refer to the
decrypted device. As a result, the original real data file in NFS is
corrupted.

When above volume is detached, the data file in NFS is lost and data
is lost.

This patch is to add a local symbolic path which refer to real file
in NFS share folder, and return the symbolic path in connection_info.

When attaching encryptors, Nova makes the symbolic path refer to
decrypted device, and doesn't destroy real file in NFS share folder.

Change-Id: I6d2ce5e638d713eb12e5cde2e91e17df1c7263e2
Closes-bug: #1511255

commit_message:
Build timeouts task filters deleting instances

The periodic task _check_instance_build_time sets instance
to error state on build timeout.Add a filter for deleting
instances so that there vm_state is not set to error.Also
provide a test case to validate that deleting instances are
ignored.

Change-Id: I0a4790cab7f83bbd464b1c5f75043d7f467cc707
Closes-Bug: #1501556

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-05-19 07:53:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Omit exceptions during snapshot cleanup

Rally scenario snapshot_server may fail occasionally at nova boot.
nova complains about image not ready when Rally tries to boot
a new instance with the snapshot after it waits the snapshot to
become ACTIVE.

When create a snapshot for an instance, VMware driver will create
a temporary VM, then export the root disk to Glance. The temporary
VM and the snapshot will be deleted when the image upload is done,
and the image will set to ACTIVE.

The ACTIVE status of an image is considered to be ready to go to
the next operation to boot a new instance from the image in Rally.

However, exception may be thrown during the cleanup operations.
nova-compute will try to delete the image in case of error.
The image status will be set to "deleting" when it happens.

In the mean time, when Rally drives nova to create a new instance
for the image, nova-api will check whether the image status is
"ACTIVE" but it may just have been set to "deleting" which causes
the boot operation to fail.

This commit will omit exceptions during the cleanup to prevent
the image status from changing once the upload is done.

Change-Id: Ia47a477b1f24d462d9c4e7085bdf187ab1f5b3ad
Closes-Bug: 1487950
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Omit exceptions during snapshot cleanup

Rally scenario snapshot_server may fail occasionally at nova boot.
nova complains about image not ready when Rally tries to boot
a new instance with the snapshot after it waits the snapshot to
become ACTIVE.

When create a snapshot for an instance, VMware driver will create
a temporary VM, then export the root disk to Glance. The temporary
VM and the snapshot will be deleted when the image upload is done,
and the image will set to ACTIVE.

The ACTIVE status of an image is considered to be ready to go to
the next operation to boot a new instance from the image in Rally.

However, exception may be thrown during the cleanup operations.
nova-compute will try to delete the image in case of error.
The image status will be set to "deleting" when it happens.

In the mean time, when Rally drives nova to create a new instance
for the image, nova-api will check whether the image status is
"ACTIVE" but it may just have been set to "deleting" which causes
the boot operation to fail.

This commit will omit exceptions during the cleanup to prevent
the image status from changing once the upload is done.

Change-Id: Ia47a477b1f24d462d9c4e7085bdf187ab1f5b3ad
Closes-Bug: 1487950
